By acting as a virtual hub for data assets ranging from tables and dashboards to models & code, Atlan enables teams to create a single source of truth for all their data assets and collaborate across the modern data stack through deep integrations with tools like Slack, BI tools, data science tools, and more.
Secoda offers digital collaborative knowledge management tools specializing in metadata, queries, charts and documentation sharing.

BigID operates as a security company that offers risk management, privacy of customer data and data intelligence. The solutions allow organizations to find, classify and catalog sensitive data from the cloud to data centers. BigID serves enterprises across multi industries. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in New York, New York.

Castor operates a data catalog platform. It provides enterprise users with tools to collect, discover, understand and use datasets according to business needs. The solution automatically documents datasets and provides an overview of the entire data environment, giving employees the ability to search through all available data assets in the company. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Paris, France.

Solidatus is a data lineage and visualization tool application that allows organizations to rapidly discover, visualize, and understand how data flows through their systems. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in London, England.

Skyhigh Security is a name for the McAfee Enterprise security service edge business. McAfee is a security technology company, headquartered in Santa Clara, California, that delivers proactive and proven solutions and services that secure systems and networks.

DemystData helps financial institutions optimize customer interactions through improved access to information. The company brings together online, social, and internal company data to create more comprehensive profiles and refined customer predictions.
Elementl is a software solution company. The company offers a system for building modern data applications. It is based in San Francisco, California.
Prefect Technologies is a workflow management system designed for modern infrastructure and powered by the open-source Prefect Core workflow engine.
Mage offers digital AI solutions to build, improve, and integrate AI models into apps.

Seqera Labs provides open-source workflow orchestration software for data pipeline processing, cloud infrastructure, and secure collaboration. The company's products include Nextflow, Wave Containers, and Tower Enterprise, Tower Cloud. It was founded in 2018 and is based in Barcelona, Spain.

Akuity provides solutions that empower DevOps engineers to deliver applications more simply, more safely, and faster. It is powered by Argo, the open-source suite of Kubernetes-native application delivery software. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Sunnyvale, California.
Union.ai is the developer of Flyte, a platform for programming and processing concurrent AI and data analytics workflows. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Seattle, Washington.

Astronomer develops data orchestration solutions based on Apache Airflow. The company's suite of products and services include Astronomer Cloud, a multi-tenant, multi-cloud Airflow as a Service and Astronomer Enterprise, a Kubernetes-native platform to easily deploy, manage, and scale distributed Airflow services.

Neurelo provides a data access platform. The company offers a platform that abstracts database complexities, providing auto-generated application program interfaces (APIs) and custom query APIs with AI assistance, enabling developers to build and run applications more efficiently with PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and MySQL. It primarily serves the software development industry. It was founded in 2022 and is based in Los Altos, California.

Provider of full service application hosting and professional services specializing in complete end-to-end solutions. The company offers complete IT outsourcing, ISV hosting solutions, PC-lifecycle management, and electronic software distribution. The company develops and implements enterprise-wide solutions for server-based application deployment, thin-client, network security, wireless connectivity, and other networking solutions. The professional services encompass consulting, system design and integration, certified training, and support.

Validio is a SaaS company that offers a cloud-based solution for enterprise customers for real-time validation, monitoring and cleaning of big data. The platform aims to help data teams eliminate bad data through monitoring, validation and cleaning of data in real time streams and batches. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

Manta is a tool for the automatic analysis of information flows in business intelligence, enabling companies to automate data flow mapping in complex environments. The tool can optimize systems, reduce development costs, perform impact analyses, and comply with regulatory requirements such as GDPR, CCAR, or HIPAA. It caters to companies across all industries, such as healthcare, banking, and more. Manta was founded in 2015 and is based in New York, New York.

Acceldata provides a big data APM (Application performance management) solution assisting enterprises to optimize data lake operations, predicting failures, and troubleshooting. It provides insights into application performance, detects anomalies and alerts which can be used by data engineers, architects, and cluster operators. Acceldata analyzes performance bottlenecks and generates recommendations for remediation. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Jose, California.

Great Expectations focuses on data quality and collaboration in the technology sector. The company offers a platform that provides data testing, documentation, and profiling services, enabling users to maintain data integrity and accelerate data discovery. It primarily serves data teams across various sectors. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Midvale, Utah.
Synq is a platform helping data practitioners build reliability throughout the entire development life-cycle, from planning to production.

Sifflet is a cloud-native solution aimed at helping organizations make the most of their data. The company's platform handles the complex process of connecting to different data sources and adapts instantly to the data volumes, enabling every type and size of business to make data management more accessible. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Paris, France.

Databand develops a software platform for agile machine learning development. The company is developing a framework that aims to offer cross-team standardization and complete visibility for project stakeholders. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel. As of July 6th, 2022, Databand was acquired by IBM. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Telmai develops a no-code data quality analysis and monitoring platform. Its product automatically detects data quality issues as data is being ingested and enables data teams to detect and investigate data quality issues. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Monte Carlo is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of data by minimizing data downtime. It solves the costly problem of broken data through its fully automated, SOC-2 Type II-certified Data Observability platform. The company monitors, alerts, resolves, and prevents data quality issues, helping data teams across various industries achieve data reliability. Monte Carlo was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Metaplane provides metadata cataloging and management solutions. The company specializes in interfaces for discovery, curation, annotation, application programming interface (API) integration, data centralization, deployments, and many more. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Lightup enables data-driven businesses to achieve their full potential. The platform allows businesses the ability to continuously measure the performance of their data-driven operations at fine granularity across the entire pipeline. Lightup is enabling businesses to continuously track vitals of their data-driven operations at the finest granularity, catch problems before their customers do, and fix them before they impact the business.

SodaData is a data monitoring platform for data owners, data engineers and data analytics teams. It's an easy-to-use, collaborative environment that tells users about important data events in real-time, across your data infrastructure.

Timeseer offers a time-series data reliability and observability platform that automates the overall data orchestration throughout and organization to deliver on-demand data to organizational customers.

Masthead specializes in data reliability engineering within the cloud computing domain. The company offers a platform for real-time monitoring of data quality issues, automated anomaly detection, and pipeline observability, all designed to enhance data team productivity and reduce unnecessary compute costs. It primarily serves the data analytics sector. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Toronto, Canada.
Datafold automates data engineering workflows such as data quality monitoring.

Unravel Data radically transforms the way businesses understand and optimize the performance and cost of their modern data applications  and the complex data pipelines that power those applications. Providing a unified view across the entire data stack, Unravels market-leading data observability platform leverages AI, machine learning, and advanced analytics to provide modern data teams with the actionable recommendations they need to turn data into insights.
Bigeye provides software that makes it easy for teams to see whether data is precise.
Anomalo provides data validation and documentation services for developers.
datavirtuality is a B2B software that integrates the variety of Big Data. It acts as an intelligent data hub - connecting any data, any system, any time.

WiseLayer focuses on leveraging artificial intelligence to enhance financial profitability and reduce risks within the finance sector. The company offers an AI platform that integrates with existing financial tools to analyze data and provide actionable alerts on issues affecting profitability and risk. It primarily serves growth-stage Fortune 500 companies, offering AI-driven insights and protections akin to an 'antivirus for the finance organization. It was founded in 2022 and is based in New York, New York.

Mozart Data is a one-stop-shop for setting up and optimizing a modern data platform. If users have data spread across a variety of SaaS tools like Shopify, Salesforce, or Zendesk, Mozart collects and organizes that data, making it accessible in whichever data visualization tool they like. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

DoubleCloud specializes in data analytics infrastructure, offering solutions in the data management and analytics domain. The company provides managed services for open-source data technologies and tools for building data pipelines, including data ingestion, storage, orchestration, ELT, and real-time visualization. These services cater to various sectors such as advertising, gaming, education, finance, and more, enabling efficient data analytics for different business scenarios. It was founded in 2022 and is based in Newburyport, Massachusetts.
Adverity offers a marketing and ETL platform that can connect and manage data sources, create data stack with data normalization, and calculate and clean up functionalities.

Prequel is a company that focuses on data synchronization and data warehouse integration. The company offers services that allow businesses to sync and ingest data to and from their customer's data warehouses, providing a simplified and efficient data sharing solution. Prequel primarily serves the data management and business intelligence sectors. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Selfr focuses on data infrastructure within the technology industry. The company offers a turnkey data infrastructure service that allows users to centralize their data, build transformation pipelines with artificial intelligence(AI), and deliver trusted dashboards to every team, without requiring any data engineering or data stack. The primary sectors that it caters to include businesses in need of data management and analytics. It was founded in 2021 and is based in New York, New York.

Sequentum is a software development company which focuses on web data extraction and web automation technologies, and provides related consulting and managed data services. The company's software significantly reduces the time, effort and cost of precise web data extraction at scale while bringing reliability and accuracy to the data extraction process.

Nexla provides a data operations platform that manages inter-company data collaboration, securely. It automates data operations so companies can derive value from their data with minimal engineering required. It allows business users to send, receive, transform, and monitor data in their preferred format via an easy-to-use web interface. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Millbrae, California.

Keboola provides a cloud-based data platform that helps clients combine, enhance and publish crucial information for their internal analytics projects and data products. It offers a flow builder, data catalog, integrations, data science, development branches, and other tools. It primarily caters to eCommerce, financial services, restaurants, retail, car dealership, marketing agencies, and other companies. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Prague 7, Czech Republic.

Y42 is a no-code business intelligence platform for loading, cleaning, connecting, visualizing, and sharing data. It offers a data platform that allows the user to set up a stacked platform without engineering investment from integrating data sources to automating data pipelines and dashboards. The platform caters its services to SaaS, marketing agencies, and eCommerce sectors. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

5x integrates different data technology vendors to create a data platform specific to the business. The company enables other companies to answer business questions without having to worry about building data infrastructure. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Singapore, Singapore.

DataSet operates as a cloud-based platform built for live or historical data, at a petabyte scale. It processes live data in real time and delivers log management, data analytics, data queries, insights, and more. It was founded in 2011 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Rubrik makes data protection software that businesses employ to ensure that business documents can be restored if they are lost due to a technical failure or a ransomware assault. Customers can store backup copies of their documents in the cloud for convenient access with Rubrik. To ensure that ransomware assaults do not damage backup copies of organizations' data, the company's products use a method known as zero-trust data management.

Cribl is a company focusing on making open observability a reality for tech professionals. The Cribl product suite defies data gravity with choice and control by delivering the freedom and flexibility to make choices rather than compromises. With Cribl, companies have the power to control their data, get more out of existing investments, and shape the observability future. The Cribl product suite is used by clients across industries spanning financial services, healthcare, retail, manufacturing, and more. Cribl was founded in 2017 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Honeycomb is an infrastructure monitoring startup that has built a cloud service for monitoring various layers of software that companies depend on to run applications. Built for engineers with operational responsibilities  software, infrastructure, platform, operations, DevOps, SRE  Honeycomb provides full stack observability. The product is designed from the ground up for debugging live production software, consuming event data from any source with any data model, and making collaboration a central part of problem-solving. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Moogsoft develops AIOps technology that helps enterprise IT Ops and DevOps teams become faster, smarter and more effective. Moogsoft AIOps' real-time machine learning algorithms help teams remediate issues that impact their customers' experience by reducing operational noise (alert fatigue) across the production stack, proactively detecting Incidents and correlating events across the monitoring ecosystem, streamlining collaboration and workflow across teams and toolsets, and codifying knowledge to make operators smarter when encountering future incidents. The company was founded in 2011 and is based in San Francisco, California.

CAST AI is a SaaS company specializing in cost optimization for customers running cloud-native applications in AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Miami, Florida.

ScienceLogic engages in IT Operations Management, providing IT operations with insights to resolve and predict problems. Its AIOps platform sees everything across cloud and distributed architectures, contextualizes data through relationship mapping, and acts on this insight through integration and automation. The company was founded in 2003 and is based in Reston, Virginia.

Dynatrace specializes in digital performance management, and is an AI-powered, full stack and completely automated solution that provides answers based on deep insight into every user, every transaction, across every application.

Veeam Software is an information technology company that develops backup, disaster recovery and data management software for virtual, physical and cloud-based workloads. On January 9, 2020, Veeam Software was acquired by Insight Partners at a valuation between $5000-5548.37M.

New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) develops cloud-based software to help website and application owners track the performance of their services. The company's SaaS-based solution provides an interface for web and native mobile applications and consolidates the performance monitoring data for any chosen technology in an environment. The firm was founded in 2008 and is based in San Francisco, California.
SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI) is a company that develops software for businesses to help manage their networks, systems, and information technology infrastructure.

Chronosphere provides an observability platform that helps engineering organizations by taming rampant data growth and cloud-native complexity. The platform offers SaaS monitoring solutions for limited data retention and wasted engineering time debugging monitoring issues, cloud-native monitoring, and more solutions. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Issaquah, Washington.

Splunk (NASDAQ: SPLK) provides a software platform that enables organizations to gain operational intelligence. Its software collects and indexes data, regardless of format or source, and enables users to quickly and easily search, correlate, analyze, monitor, and report on this data. The company was founded in 2005 and is based in San Francisco, California.

PagerDuty offers alerting and incident tracking system that helps IT operations and DevOps engineers resolve critical errors in IT systems as quickly as possible. PagerDuty's operations performance platform helps companies increase reliability. By connecting people, systems, and data in a single view, PagerDuty delivers visibility and intelligence across global operations for effective incident resolution management.

Embrace operates as an observability and data platform. It offers an error-monitoring platform to analyze and access unique datasets of phones, tablets, and more. The company provides applications that help to identify, replay, and diagnose mobile issues through the automated analysis of each and every user session. It was formerly known as Pubfirst. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Culver City, California.

Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) offers a monitoring and security platform for developers, information technology operations teams, and business users available in the cloud. The company collects data from servers, databases, applications, tools, and services to present a unified view of the infrastructure. These capabilities are provided on a SaaS-based monitoring and data analytics platform that enables multiple teams to work collaboratively on the infrastructure to avoid downtime, resolve performance problems and ensure that development and deployment cycles finish on time. The company was founded in 2010 and is based in New York, New York.

AppDynamics is a provider of Software-as-Service (SaaS) and on-premise application performance management for modern application architectures in both the cloud and the data center. The company delivers solutions for highly distributed and agile environments, helping companies monitor, troubleshoot, diagnose, and scale production applications. AppDynamics has combined its technology platform with an "easy-to-use" approach which enables Development and Operations teams to be up and running on AppDynamics within minutes.

Grafana Labs supports projects such as Grafana, an open-source software for visualizing time series data. Grafana Labs enables users to take control of their unified monitoring and avoid vendor lock-in and the spiraling costs of closed solutions. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in New York, New York.
Privacera is focused on helping enterprises discover, manage, and monitor sensitive data within their systems.

OneTrust operates as a software platform for privacy professionals. The platform operationalizes data privacy compliance and Privacy by Design. The web-based console helps automate privacy impact assessments and data mapping, identify privacy risks, and enforce risk management and control activities in an integrated and agile approach. The result is the ability to demonstrate accountability and compliance with EU's data protection requirements globally across privacy jurisdictions and frameworks. The company serves customers across a range of industries. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Atlanta, Georgia.

InCountry develops a product to help companies comply with laws on how user profile and registration information should be stored and maintained. Through the service, data is housed in private data centers or with public cloud operators that operate within the country of origin, therefore ensuring compliance with data residency laws. The company also provides software development kits in a range of popular programming languages, so that companies can easily access their customer data to build new apps and services.

Opaque provides a cloud-based service for secure analytics and machine learning on encrypted data, enabling data teams to extract value from and collaborate over data silos without exposing the data to anyone. Opaque was founded in 2021 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Piiano focuses on data protection for backend developers. The company offers two main services Piiano Vault, which provides application programming interfaces (APIs) for encrypting, tokenizing, and storing sensitive data, and Piiano Flows, which analyzes application source code to detect potential data leaks. It primarily serves the healthcare and electronic commerce industries. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

Very Good Security offers a modern approach to data security and compliance, enabling companies to use sensitive data without the liability or costs of data custodianship. VGS' purpose-built infrastructure lets companies retain full use of sensitive data without ever needing to see or hold the data themselves. Companies can thus rapidly adopt a comprehensive security and privacy posture, making it easy to inherit and maintain compliance certifications like PCI-DSS, SOC-2, GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA and more.
Ketch helps organizations satisfy their data privacy and governance through a data control platform.

Transcend develops an end-to-end solution for handling requests to access, erase, update, and transfer personal data. It seeks to give users more control over their data by making it easier for them to see how apps are using their personal data and downloading it.

Cyera focuses on data security. The company offers a data security platform that provides services such as data discovery and classification, data access governance, and data security posture management. Cyera primarily serves sectors such as financial services, healthcare, manufacturing, retail and travel, and technology services. It was founded in 2021 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Duality Technologies is a homomorphic encryption company that develops privacy-enhancing technologies leveraging data sets, including training and tuning artificial intelligence and machine learning models, performing secure queries and statistical analysis. It offers solutions for financial services, healthcare, insurance, and government industries. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Hoboken, New Jersey.

Relyance AI is a company that focuses on data protection and privacy in the technology sector. The company offers an AI-powered platform that manages privacy, data governance, and compliance operations. It uses machine learning to build a dynamic, real-time data inventory and map, allowing for monitoring of how personal data moves through code, applications, infrastructure, and third-party vendors. Relyance AI was founded in 2020 and is based in San Mateo, California

Alcion provides a Backup-as-a-Service (BaaS) platform. The company offers data management and protects against ransomware, malware, corruption, and accidental data loss. Alcion was founded in 2022 and is based in Santa Clara, California.

Privacy Dynamics develops no-code data privacy tools built for analytics engineers. After removing or masking direct identifiers, records are analyzed and labeled. Identifiable records are treated, while unidentifiable records are left alone. The result is highly accurate, privacy-safe data. The platform has use cases in areas such as dev and test data, analytics, and healthcare. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Seattle, Washington.

Private AI develops privacy-preserving machine learning and natural language processing tools. It offers services such as ASR (Automated Speech Recognition) transcripts, machine learning, data discovery, compliance, secure storage, and named entity recognition. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Toronto, Ontario.

Open Raven is a company that focuses on data security posture management in the cloud computing industry. The company offers a platform that provides automated multi-cloud data discovery, classification, and posture management, as well as monitoring data events, detecting abnormal behavior, and responding to potential attacks. Open Raven primarily sells to sectors that require robust data security and compliance measures, such as the ecommerce industry. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Los Angeles, California.
TripleBlind offers digital privacy as a service with a suite of tools that enables companies to safely provide and consume extremely sensitive data and algorithms in encrypted space.

Dasera is a data security platform specializing in automated data security and governance solutions for finance, healthcare, and technology enterprises. Its automated data security and governance controls streamline risk management, ensuring cloud security and privacy for organizations throughout the data lifecycle. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Cape Privacy provides enterprise companies with a SaaS collaboration platform on top of advanced privacy and security technology to maximize the value of their data. It allows businesses to collaborate internally (e.g. risk, legal, compliance divisions in a bank) or with third-party vendors (e.g. an agency or outside law firm) and across organizations (even competitors such as major pharmaceutical firms) by enhancing the privacy of data.
Skyflow develops a secure platform for API usage.

Cyral's security product acts as a security layer on top of cloud data repositories  whether databases, data lakes, data warehouse or other data repository  helping identify issues like faulty configurations or anomalous activity.

Privitar provides data-privacy management solutions to companies and public sector organizations to protect sensitive data and enable ethical data analysis. It accelerates and automates the provision of privacy-preserving data. The company serves the financial services, healthcare, insurance, and retail industries. Privitar was founded in 2014 and is based in London, U.K.

Enveil is a data security company that protects data in use. The company's business-enabling and privacy-preserving capabilities for secure data search, sharing, and collaboration protect data while it's being used or processed. Powered by homomorphic encryption, Enveils ZeroReveal solutions allow organizations to securely derive insights, cross-match, and search third-party data assets without ever revealing the contents of the search itself or compromising the security or ownership of the underlying data. The company serves the financial services, healthcare, data monetization, audit & compliance, cloud security, and federal industry clients. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Fulton, Maryland.

DataGrail develops a privacy compliance and regulation platform. It provides a privacy control center where legal, security, and executive teams can run impactful privacy programs and understand the real-time risk of companies. It offers services to automate and scale privacy and stay compliant with different regulatory reforms. It was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Symmetry Systems provides a data guard, which gives unified visibility into data objects across all data stores. It provides visibility into data risks from excessive permissions and anomalous data flows. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

eXate provides data privacy solutions. It automates and applies privacy and security to sensitive data. It ensures that sensitive data attributes are only viewed by the right people, in accordance with data privacy regulations. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in London, United Kingdom.

Equinix (NASDAQ: EQIX) connects businesses with partners and customers through a global platform of high performance data centers, containing dynamic ecosystems and the broadest choice of networks. Enterprises, cloud, digital content, and financial companies connect to network service providers and rely on Platform Equinix to grow their business, improve application performance and protect their vital digital assets. The company operates in the Americas, EMEA and Asia-Pacific and continually invests in expanding its platform to power customer growth.

NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) is an advanced graphics processing company, with a product family that allows multimedia experiences for the entire desktop computer market from workstations to internet-enabled appliances.

Nuclio operates an open-source and managed server less platform for automated data science. It offers a high-performance server less platform focused on data, input/output (I/O), and computed workloads. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Herzliya, Israel.

D2iQ, formerly Mesosphere, is a provider of enterprise-grade cloud platforms that enable organizations to embrace open source and cloud native innovations while delivering smarter Day 2 operations. D2iQ empowers organizations to better navigate and accelerate cloud-native journeys with enterprise-grade technologies, training, professional services, and support.

Domo is a fully mobile, cloud-based operating system that unifies every component of a business and delivers it all on the user's phone. The company was founded in 2010 and is based in American Fork, Utah.

Omni operates a BI and data platform that turns SQL into intelligence. Its platform builds a sandbox data model as users query and allows them to promote metrics to an authoritative, shared model that can be used by the entire organization. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Grow aims to make it easy and affordable to visualize and share business performance in real-time by uniting data from hundreds of sources, including spreadsheets, databases, and SaaS applications. On March 1st, 2022, Grow was acquired by Epicor. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

SAS provides software and solutions for business analytics, data management, and AI, used to gather, manage, and analyze corporate information. It offers business analytics SaaS for a range of industries that include agriculture, banking, education, healthcare, insurance, life sciences, manufacturing, retail and consumer goods, public sector, sports, telecommunications and utility industries. The company was founded in 1976 and is based in Cary, North Carolina.

MicroStrategy (Nasdaq: MSTR) is an independent business intelligence company with an enterprise analytics platform. It provides modern analytics on an open, comprehensive enterprise platform used by global brands in the Fortune Global 500. Optimized for cloud and on-premises deployments, the platform features HyperIntelligenceÂ®, a technology that overlays actionable enterprise data on popular business applications to help users make smarter and faster decisions. The company was founded in 1989 and is based in Vienna, Virginia.

GoodData is a provider of end-to-end cloud analytics that allows users to combine, analyze, and visualize data to quickly answer business-critical questions. GoodData's mission is to help companies become all data enterprises: companies that gain a competitive advantage by leveraging all data available to them through advanced analytics. The GoodData Open Analytics Platform helps companies manage and analyze that data in one seamless, interactive environment. The company was founded in 2007 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Kyvos is a BI acceleration platform that delivers instant insights on trillions of rows of data, both on the cloud and on-premise data lakes. Using its patented OLAP technology, Kyvos builds a high-performing semantic layer on modern data platforms that enables your existing BI tools to access extremely large datasets with interactive response times and no data movement. This capability allows users across the enterprise to conduct self-service, interactive analysis on data at a massive scale using any BI tool they like.

WhizAI is a company that focuses on artificial intelligence and analytics within the life sciences industry. The company offers a platform that provides actionable insights and analytics to business users, enabling them to make informed and faster decisions. The platform is designed to understand and interpret the analytics needs of life sciences companies. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Somerset, New Jersey.

Fluent specializes in AI-driven data analysis within the business intelligence sector. The company offers a platform that allows users to query company's data using natural language and receive insights without the need for interfaces or training. Fluent primarily serves sectors that require real-time data collaboration and insights, such as the ecommerce industry and enterprise-level businesses. It was founded in 2021 and is based in London, United Kingdom.

TIBCO Software focuses on infrastructure and business intelligence software. It offers products such as TIBCO Cloud integration, TIBCO Cloud API management, TIBCO BusinessWorks, TIBCO BusinessConnect and more. The company caters to banking, credit union, energy, government, healthcare, insurance and more. TIBCO Software was founded in 1997 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Infor Global Solutions provides business applications to mid-sized companies. The company offers numerous products for human capital management, enterprise resource planning, and customer relationship management. The company offers, Infor ERP, solutions that deliver functionality and usability specifically for the manufacturing and distribution industries. On February 4th, 2020, Infor was acquired by Koch Equity Development at a valuation of $11 billion.

ThoughtSpot is a modern analytics cloud company that creates a fact-driven world with an easy-to-use analytics platform. Through its platform, users can leverage natural language search and AI to find data insights on Live Analytics. Companies can put modern data stacks in the hands of employees, extend the value of data to partners and customers, and automate entire business processes. With ThoughtSpots developer-friendly platform, ThoughtSpot Everywhere, customers can bring the Modern Analytics Cloud to their products and services. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Veezoo provides a tool enabling people to explore and visualize stock market data efficiently. The company's interface makes getting answers from data intuitive for everyone just by asking questions in plain English. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Zurich, Switzerland.

Sisense goes beyond traditional business intelligence by providing organizations with the ability to infuse analytics everywhere, embedded in both customer and employee applications and workflows. Sisense customers are breaking through the barriers of analytics adoption by going beyond the dashboard with Sisense Fusion - the highly customizable, AI-driven analytics cloud platform, that infuses intelligence at the right place and the right time, every time.

SimplyPut is a technology company that focuses on data analysis and interpretation. The company offers a platform that allows users to interact with their data using plain language, eliminating the need for coding. This is achieved through the use of advanced language models like ChatGPT and GPT-4. The company's services are primarily used in sectors that require data interpretation and analysis. It was founded in 2021 and is based in San Francisco, California.
PopSQL provides collaborative SQL query editing. PopSQL allows users to store SQL queries they run regularly, grouping them into folders that can be kept private or shared amongst their team.

Zing Data is a company that focuses on mobile-first business intelligence in the data and business intelligence sector. The company offers a platform that allows users to ask questions of data and visualize answers easily, with features such as natural language querying, real-time alerts, and embedded analytics. It primarily serves sectors such as operations, sales, and DevOps. It was founded in 2021 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Klipfolio is a company that focuses on business intelligence, specifically in the domain of data analytics and dashboard software. The company offers services that allow individuals and teams to connect to various data sources, prepare and store data, and create visualizations and reports for informed decision-making. Klipfolio primarily serves sectors that require data-driven decision making, such as the ecommerce industry, real estate tech industry, and cloud computing industry. It is based in Ottawa, Ontario

Metabase is an open-source analytics and business intelligence application that can connect to the most commonly used databases. It lets anyone in a company quickly ask questions, and create dashboards or nightly emails without knowing SQL. Metabase was founded in 2014 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Salesforce (NYSE: CRM) is an enterprise cloud computing provider. The company supplies a customer relationship management service to businesses worldwide providing a technology platform for customers and developers to build and run business applications. Its clients use salesforce.com to manage their customer, sales, and operational data. Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Community Cloud, Salesforce Analytics, and App Cloud are the product developed by the platform. It primarily focuses on automotive, communication, healthcare, education, financial services, non-profit, media, and other industries. The company was founded in 1999 and is based in San Francisco, California.

AtScale provides enterprises with a universal semantic platform for Business Intelligence on Big Data, allowing business users at corporations across financial services, healthcare, telecommunications, retail, and online industries to get interactive and multi-dimensional analysis capabilities, directly on Hadoop and cloud-based big data platforms.

Whaly is a self-service business intelligence platform that specializes in AI-powered data solutions for various industries. The company offers a suite of tools for data collection, analysis, and visualization, enabling users to make informed decisions and drive business growth without requiring technical expertise. Whaly's solutions cater to roles across sales, retail, and other sectors, providing real-time analytics, performance monitoring, and actionable insights. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Montreuil, France.

Looker provides a SaaS unified platform for data that delivers business insights to every employee at the point of decision. It delivers applications through its platform, including Business Intelligence, business-specific solutions such as Digital Marketing Analytics and Web Event Analytics, and a flexible, embedded analytics framework. The solution also integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web scale. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Santa Cruz, California.

Lightdash provides an open-sourced business intelligence (BI) platform for analysts to write metrics. It enables self-serve for the entire business and offers a developer-friendly BI platform with popular data insights warehouse integrations. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.
Toucan Toco provides a data storytelling platform that allows organizations to provide insights to non-technical business users.

Astrato is a cloud-based reporting and dashboarding solution provider. It offers a no-code framework to build powerful data visualizations and custom data applications that actively drive better business decisions. It provides a live query data visualization and analytics solution that enables everyone to make live data decisions. It was founded in 2016 and is based in London, United Kingdom.

Yellowfin is a BI platform that combines machine learning, visualization, collaboration, and storytelling to provide customers with the quickest time to value. Yellowfin machine-learning algorithms help analysts respond quickly and help business users answer "Why?" on their own. Users can create interactive presentations and control the narrative, while allowing their audience to explore. On January 31st, 2022, Yellowfin was acquired by Idera. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) is a multinational technology company. It manufactures and sells computer software, consumer electronics, personal computers (PCs), and related services. It also offers the Microsoft Windows line of operating systems, the Microsoft Office suite of productivity software, and the Edge website browser. The company was founded in 1975 and is based in Redmond, Washington.
Grid allows Excel users to turn spreadsheets into modern web applications without learning any new skills.

Graphext specializes in exploratory data analysis, data storytelling, and predictive modeling. The company provides a visual interface for data scientists and business analysts to analyze, visualize, and derive insights from data, as well as create and deploy predictive models. It serves various sectors including marketing, healthcare, finance, and more, with a focus on making data science accessible to a broader range of users. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Granada, Spain.

Observable empowers everyone to create, collaborate, and learn with data. People can discover insights faster and collaborate seamlessly with interactive Observable notebooks built for data analysis, visualization, and exploration. It is based in San Francisco, California.

Preset offers an open analytics data platform built on Apache Superset. The company's digital platform aims to help users to explore and analyze their data. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Datawrapper helps to create interactive charts, maps, and bars for data visualization. Some of its responsive and customizable graphics include heat maps, choropleth maps, symbol maps, split bars, pie charts, locator maps, and more. It also automates chart creation using application programming interface (API) integrations. The company serves media companies, government organizations, and financial institutions to replace static reports with interactive ones. It was founded in 2011 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

Tableau Software is a company that specializes in business intelligence and analytics. The company offers a platform that allows users to connect to various databases, create visualizations, and share insights, making data more understandable and actionable. It primarily serves the business intelligence and data analytics industry. It was founded in 2003 and is based in Seattle, Washington.

Streamlit is an app framework specifically for machine learning and data science teams. Streamlit aims to turn data scripts into shareable web apps in pure Python. On March 2nd, 2022, Streamlit was acquired by Snowflake at a valuation of $800M.

Google (NASDAQ: GOOGL) operates as a multinational technology company. It specializes in internet-related services and products including, online advertising technologies, search engine technology, cloud computing, computer software, and more. The company provides products such as Google Maps, Google Drive, Google Docs, YouTube, Gmail, and more. It also offers cloud services and other products such as Chromebooks, the Pixel smartphone, and smart home products, which include Nest and Google Home. It was founded in 1998 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Infogram is a data visualization platform solution company. The company offers infographics, data visualization, graphs, charts, data storytelling, maps, reports, presentation, data storytelling, and visual communication. It is based in San Francisco, California.

Cumul.io provides a data platform to connect and combine data from any source, and analyze it into dashboards. It offers a low-code platform for data analysis with integration into other SaaS platforms or applications. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Leuven, Belgium.
Plotly is a technical computing company that develops online data analytics and visualization tools. It is based in Montreal, Quebec.

Rill Data develops a fully managed cloud service platform that provides data analytics. The product consists of a database designed to process key data from the underlying data source more quickly. It was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Airtable enables teams to create apps on top of shared data to power workflows. Users can bring their data together using integrations, extensible APIs, custom scripting and more. The company provides solutions to organizational departments within Marketing, Product Operations, Human Resources, Sales, Operations, Content Operations, FInance and more. It was founded in 2013 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Mode makes data analysts more productive by enabling them to easily share and discover each other's work. Mode works with languages analysts are already familiar with - SQL, R, and Python - and records their work from end to end to provide a complete, shareable, auditable picture of any type of analysis.
Pecan AI is a deep learning platform that automatically generates business intelligence predictions for companies and organizations.
Narrator is a data intelligence company that equips decision makers with personalized insights.

Anodot applies AI to deliver autonomous analytics in real-time, across all data types, at enterprise scale. Unlike the manual limitations of traditional Business Intelligence, the company provides analysts mastery over their business with a self-service AI platform that runs continuously to eliminate blind spots, alert incidents, and investigate root causes.

Workstream is a hub for analytical work where a team can organize their data products, get insights into their impact, and more easily collaborate with stakeholders. The company unifies the workflow of complex, analytical projects. As a collaboration solution purpose-built for analysts, Workstream natively integrates with existing analytical tools. Through its solution, teams can consolidate their workflow into a single experience, allowing them to streamline collaboration, better orchestrate their projects, and power better business results. Workstream's platform is used by the data teams of various organizations. Workstream was founded in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.
Hashboard is a platform for data exploration. The company helps democratize data inside organizations.

Ascend.io has developed a platform that introduces new cognitive models for working with big data pipelines that refocusses efforts on what matters most to businesses. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

SmartSuite provides a collaborative work management platform. It offers project management, product management, quality assurance, security operations, business continuity planning, and more. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Newport Beach, California.

Acho is a company that focuses on data application development in the business software industry. The company offers a low-code platform that enables businesses to build custom software for automation, business intelligence, data science, and client-facing applications. This software allows businesses to analyze, predict, and automate their data, turning it into scalable and interactive applications. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Allston, Massachusetts.

Sigma offers a cloud-hosted data analytics platform. Its spreadsheet-like front end supports upwards of 10 billion rows, with formulas, calculations, and definitions that transform data from any source. Sigma Computing was formerly known as Bitmoon Computing. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Guavus is a big data analytics company ushering in a new class of analytically powered applications for communications service providers and enterprise customers. The company offers an operational intelligence platform integrated with a suite of decisioning applications for network planning and operations, marketing, security and customer care. The world's most data-intensive companies trust Guavus to help them take strategic advantage of their data assets to grow revenue, improve operating efficiencies and delight customers in new ways. It analyzes more than 50% of all US mobile data traffic and processes more than 2.5 petabytes of data per day.

Incorta is a cloud-based analytical warehouse solution engineered to quickly and easily analyze massive volumes of data from multiple sources. Users can securely access any amount of the latest and most relevant data from one source of truth, ensuring that all users are accessing, analyzing, and collaborating around consistent information.

Preql offers a no-code data transformation platform that enables business users to access analysis-ready data without having to learn SQL or rely on a data team. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Brooklyn, New York.

Pyramid Analytics aims to deliver a BI platform that provides business users with the tools needed to gain insights about their business in a way that is natural and does not require any particular technical skills while allowing a depth of analysis comparable to the best applications available. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Amsterdam, Netherlands.

HelloTrace is a seed-stage startup that operates in the data analytics and business intelligence domain. The company offers a metrics platform that enables organizations to define key business concepts such as entities, metrics, drivers of metrics, and relationships in a collaborative environment, thereby facilitating a democratic data culture backed by good governance. Primarily, HelloTrace's services cater to data teams and operators in various organizations. It was founded in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.

Deephaven is a complete data system that empowers users to quickly build analyses, models, algorithms, reports and dashboards. Engineered for massive data sets, Deephaven is a powerful and expressive programming language seamlessly integrated with a high performance database and an intuitive user interface. Designed for programmers and non-programmers alike, Deephaven uses concise and clear syntax to enable a wide variety of complex analyses. Deephaven was founded in 2015 and is based in New York, New York.

Equals provides a spreadsheet with built-in connections to any database, versioning, and collaboration. It enables users to build any analysis with data directly from their database, whether or not they know SQL. Equals was founded in 2021 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Seek AI provides a data analytics platform intended to offer solutions for data bottleneck problems in organizations. Its platform uses artificial intelligence to reduce human error and inefficiencies in the organization's data team, enabling organizations to deliver projects in less time and at a reduced cost. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in New York, New York.
Cube Dev is a developer framework for building analytics applications. It provides a complete backend API platform over the raw data while giving full customization and flexibility on the frontend.
Sisu Data is building software that aims to help people make decisions with data.

Rows offer a platform for users to create applications from spreadsheets. The platform provides integrations and conversion of the spreadsheet into web apps, without programming knowledge. It was formerly known as dashdash. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

Noogata specializes in no-code artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. Its modular AI platform provides recommendations, competitor insights, and action tools to increase revenue and grow businesses. It was founded in 2019 and is based in New York, New York.

Weld is the all-in-one data solution for modern teams. Weld platform allows companies to build powerful data models and metrics, enabling greater insights and expedited decision-making capabilities, as well as streamlining data workflows.

Tellius provides typical BI features such as dashboards and data preparation with AI-powered capabilities. Its Genius Insights Engine analyzes data automatically to reveal hidden insights and eliminate the guesswork from the analysis. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Reston, Virginia.

Datameer offers an agile analytics lifecycle platform that enables enterprises to unlock the value of all their data. Without any code, teams can rapidly integrate, transform, discover, and operationalize datasets to their projects. Datameer breaks down data siloes, gets companies ahead of their data demands, and empowers everyone to discover insights.

Lido is a provider of a no-code data integration platform. The platform enables enterprises to integrate all enterprise data, such as custom databases, customer service, market research, social media, web analytics, e-commerce and sales, and more, into one platform. It was founded in 2018 and is based in New York City, New York.

Clarisights operates as a company focusing on providing no-code reporting solutions in the marketing and data analytics industry. The company offers a platform that integrates, processes, and visualizes data from various marketing sources, enabling users to generate reports without the need for coding or data science expertise. Primarily, Clarisights caters to the needs of performance marketing and growth teams in scale-up and enterprise businesses. Clarisights was formerly known as Granular Insights. It was founded in 2018 and is based in Lewes, Delaware.

Canvas is a collaborative data exploration tool that helps business teams make decisions without SQL. It automates reporting and shares insights using spreadsheet abilities. It was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

iGenius has created an Augmented Intelligence that enables businesses to talk with client's data. Its product, Crystal, introduces a consumerized no-code user experience for decision intelligence. The ability to talk with data via a virtual advisor and receive data-driven responses makes technology as complex as AI accessible to anyone. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Milan, Italy.

BlueConic helps brands optimize cross-channel marketing opportunities through improved customer engagement. It offers a SaaS-based online customer engagement platform that leverages a Big Data profile interaction store and machine learning to help marketers synchronize relevant communications across web, mobile and social channels in real time.

Adobe (NASDAQ: ADBE) operates as a multinational computer software company. It develops and markets software products and services for creative professionals, businesses, and consumers. It offers Adobe Express, a cloud-based design and publishing platform that allows users to create social media graphics, website pages, and other visual content, and Adobe Lightroom, a photo editing software for editing photos, including adjusting the exposure, contrast, and color. The company was founded in 1982 and is based in San Jose, California

Simon Data is a platform that uses data to improve a company's marketing strategy. Simon Data unifies disparate data sources, connects data to a company's marketing channels, and runs rigorous tests and tracks results to improve the user's marketing campaign.

Treasure Data is a cloud-based enterprise customer data platform (CDP) that lets non-specialists get value out of data without a big IT overhead. The company provides the ability to aggregate and translate massive volumes of scattered and siloed data.
Syncari is a modern data automation platform that helps businesses solve costly data inconsistencies and integration challenges revenue teams face today.

mParticle puts app owners in full control of their data assets while helping to solve many of the complications that go along with running a mobile business. mParticle not only solves the core challenges of truly creating personalization in mobile but also gives app owners better marketing insights, autonomy from IT cycles, accelerates the launch of new partners/campaigns, and significantly improves app performance & stability. Through a unique approach to mobile data management, mParticle empowers clients to collect, organize and synchronize data, from mobile web and apps. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in New York, New York.

Lytics provides adaptive digital marketing and offers a marketing activation platform that integrates all touch points and surfaces behaviors of customers and prospects to recommend how to best target audiences across Web, mobile, email, and social channels. Through machine learning, its cloud-based software predicts SmartAudience segments and suggests opportunities to marketers to adapt their tactics in real-time.
ActionIQ is an enterprise customer data platform that aims to solve the problems marketers face including the flow and scale of data, analytics, and campaigns.

Blueshift helps consumer brands intelligently scale their customer engagement. It's Customer Data Activation Platform uses patented AI technology to unlock the value of customer data and enables marketers to orchestrate individualized customer journeys across every owned and paid channel.

Optimove develops CRM software primarily for business-to-consumer brands. The companys platform aims to use AI to discover customer segments and orchestrate CRM journeys, facilitating the management of marketing communications with up to hundreds of segments. Marketers use Optimove to manage and automate their entire cross-channel customer marketing plan. By automatically personalizing, executing, and evaluating a complete system of customer-data-driven campaigns, the software enables marketers to maximize revenues and customer lifetime value. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

GrowthLoop is a marketing agility platform that offers software, databases, and cloud computing services to generate leads and increase sales for marketers. It specializes in marketing campaigns, customer audience building, visual customer audience building, cloud storage, and more. Its platform facilitates audience segmentation, customer journey orchestration, and multi-channel campaign measurement. It was formerly known as Flywheel. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Zeotap focuses on helping brands monetize customer data, operating within the data solutions and marketing industry. It offers services such as a customer data platform for integrating and managing customer data, a data delivery service for targeted marketing, and a universal marketing ID initiative. Zeotap primarily serves the marketing and programmatic advertising sectors. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

Insider is a multi-channel digital experience platform for marketers. Accessible from a unified data engine, Insider enables marketers to leverage personalization, predictive segmentation, and real-time technologies to boost loyalty and digital growth.
Amperity provides an Intelligent Customer Data Platform empowering global consumer brands to create personalized experiences by leveraging all their customer data.

Funnel is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) company. The company offers a platform that allows users to gather, store, organize, and share marketing data from various sources, aiming to enhance reporting and decision-making processes. Its services are utilized by sectors such as digital marketing, data analysis, information technology (IT), and various industries, including agencies, business-to-consumer (B2C), and business-to-consumer (B2B). It was founded in 2014 and is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

data.ai is a decision-making platform for the mobile app economy. data.ai combines the analytics of one's own apps with a granular understanding of the competition and market to provide a unique 360 degree view of one's mobile business.

WhatFix is a SaaS customer engagement startup that helps businesses onboard their customers and provides interactive knowledge flows to enhance product adoption. It allows for the creation of interactive support FAQs, training materials, and tutorials which can be integrated across all touch-points inside applications, blogs, and more.

Avo operates as a data quality platform for product analytics. It offers a tool for defining event-based analytics and generating personalized tracking libraries. It provides time validation of correct implementation. Its tracking plan interface lets teams standardize event schemas, branched workflows, and peer reviews to keep stakeholders informed. It was formerly known as Viska. It was founded in 2018 and is based in Covina, California.

PostHog offers a suite of open source suite of products operating systems and tools. The company provides open-source product analytics, as well as helps engineers understand product usage, and automates events, and user data collection. PostHog was formerly known as Hiberly. It was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.
Google Analytics is an American multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products. The company is based in Mountain View, California.
Mixpanel is a real-time analytics service that helps companies understand how users interact with web applications.

FullStory develops software that records user interactions on a website or app, providing product and support teams insight into the interactions of visitors and customers. By adding a script to any website, FullStory records user interactions during a visit, enabling session playback that can replay everything from navigation to mouse clicks exactly as each user experienced it. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Atlanta, Georgia.

Pendo is a product cloud that helps digital product teams and application owners deliver software experiences to users. The Pendo Product Cloud surfaces insights from product usage patterns, user sentiment, and user feedback to help product teams understand how people are using their products. Teams then use these insights to improve the product experience with smarter product decisions, in-app messages, guides, and product walkthroughs.

Amplitude (NASDAQ: AMPLT) provides mobile analytics that help companies leverage data to improve user growth. Amplitude provides Amplitude Analytics, a Built on Nova platform which gives companies access to user behavior analytics for mobile and web to pinpoint and act in order to reach better retention, engagement, and conversion results.

Kubit is a product analytics platform running directly on a cloud data warehouse. The platform delivers self-service product insights to help understand user behavior, improve engagement retention, and fuel product growth. It was founded in 2018 and is based in Oakland, California.
Glassbox (TASE: GLBX) provides a platform that enables companies to optimize digital customer experiences across web, mobile web and mobile apps and provides automatic insights.

Sprig operates as a product insights platform. The company offers services such as real-time surveys, session replays, prototype testing, and artificial intelligence (AI) analysis to help product teams understand user behavior and improve product experiences. It primarily serves the tech industry, with top tech companies among its key customer segments. It was formerly known as UserLeap. It was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Heap automatically collects and organizes customer behavioral data, allowing businesses to analyze customer experiences and create products without the typical costs associated with analytics implementations. It automatically captures every web, mobile, and cloud interaction: clicks, submits, transactions, emails, and more, to allow users to retroactively analyze data without writing code.

ContentSquare monitors touch and mouse movements on websites and apps to understand how these services are used. It leverages data to improve users' experience and increase engagement. Contentsquare helps brands everywhere transform the way they do business, allowing them to take action at enterprise scale and build customer trust with security, privacy and accessibility. Contentsquare was founded in 2012 and is based in Paris, France.

Better Stack focuses on incident management and observability in the tech industry. The company offers services such as incident management, log management, and observability dashboards, which help businesses spot, resolve, and prevent downtime. These services primarily cater to the needs of the software development and IT sectors. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Prague, Czech Republic.

LogicMonitor is the SaaS-based performance monitoring solution, enabling IT Ops teams to intelligently monitor the infrastructure, applications and services fueling businesses. LogicMonitor, a software-as-a-service, or SaaS, company that helps businesses monitor data centers and flag possible problems.

Observe is a SaaS observability company that discerns why applications and infrastructure are running the way they are from the data they emit. The company enables engineers to spend more time coding features and less time investigating incidents. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Mezmo is an observability platform to manage and take action on data. It ingests, processes, and routes log data to fuel enterprise-level application development and delivery, security, and compliance use cases. It offers solutions such as reducing SIEM costs, ELK replacement, enabling digital transformation, and DevSecOps and Control. It was formerly known as LogDNA. It was founded in 2015 and is based in San Jose, California.

Logmind operates as an artificial intelligence-based log data intelligence platform operating in the big data analytics domain. The company specializes in providing visibility and automated insights into unstructured log data for operations teams, utilizing machine learning and artificial intelligence to help in information technology system efficiency and reduce manual data analysis. Its platform is designed to automatically detect IT infrastructure and application issues, offering proactive tools to prevent production incidents and reduce false alarms. Primarily it serves the data analytics industry. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Lausanne, Switzerland

Sematext is a company specializing in infrastructure performance and log monitoring, as well as user experience analysis within the IT system monitoring and management sector. The company offers a suite of services including real-time infrastructure mapping, log management, application performance monitoring, and synthetic monitoring of websites and APIs. Sematext primarily serves DevOps teams, providing tools for full-stack visibility and operational insights. It was founded in 2007 and is based in Brooklyn, New York.

Graylog provides centralized log management and security information management solutions. It searches and analyzes machine data from information technology (IT) infrastructures and applications and enables organizations to capture, store, and analyze terabytes of machine data. It serves fintech, education, telecom, healthcare, and other sectors. Graylog was formerly known as Torch. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Houston, Texas.

Exabeam complements existing security information and event management and log management systems with machine-learning technology that focuses on attacker behavior rather than malware and tools to detect modern cyberattacks. Exabeam's user behavior analytics solution leverages existing log data to quickly detect advanced attacks, prioritize incidents and guide effective response. The company's Stateful User Tracking automates the work of security analysts by resolving individual security events and behavioral anomalies into a complete attack chain. The firm primarily serves retail banks, investment banks, academic institutions, retail, and technology firms. It was founded in 2013 and is based in Foster city, California.

LogRhythm, a provider in security intelligence and analytics, empowers organizations around the globe to rapidly detect, respond to and neutralize damaging cyber threats. The company's platform unifies next-generation SIEM, log management, network and endpoint monitoring, and advanced security analytics. In addition to protecting customers from the risks associated with cyber threats, LogRhythm provides unparalleled compliance automation and assurance, and enhanced IT intelligence.
Elastic is a search engine based on Lucene. It provides a distributed, multitenant-capable full-text search engine with an HTTP web interface and schema-free JSON documents.

Sumo Logic (NASDAQ: SUMO) develops software, which helps organizations address the challenges and opportunities presented by digital transformation, applications development, and cloud computing. The platform assists organizations to automate the collection, ingestion, and analysis of application, infrastructure, security, and IoT data. The company was founded in 2010 and is based in Redwood City, California.

Coralogix provides an ML-powered log analytics platform that allows DevOps teams to autonomously manage and analyze log data in cloud applications. Engineers can narrow down hundreds of millions of logs to suspected logs, broken flows, error trends, and problematic version upgrades in order to reach time to market fast, avoid customer attrition, and accelerate their version delivery without compromising quality or stability. Coralogix allows DevOps and other engineering teams a way to observe and analyze data streams before they get indexed and/or sent to storage, giving them more flexibility to query the data in different ways and glean more insights faster. Coralogix was founded in 2014 and is based in San Francisco, California.
Logz.io offers a cloud-based service that enables companies to process the diagnostics data they collect about their applications.

Nuclia is a company that specializes in artificial intelligence and data management, operating within the technology sector. The company offers a platform that uses generative AI to index unstructured data from various sources, providing optimized search results and generative answers. This allows users to search data using natural language and receive relevant responses. The company primarily serves sectors such as financial services, customer service and support, global site search, education, and AI model training and fine-tuning. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Manresa, Spain

Guru operates as a revenue empowerment network for start-ups and businesses by utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) to make sales, support, and more. It offers a Chrome extension that connects a team's knowledge to the web apps already used. It was founded in 2013 and is based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
Bloomfire's sharing platform offers sales enablement and customer support services. It was founded in 2010 and is based in Austin, Texas.

Glean is a work assistant platform that searches across all of its users' company's apps with the aim of finding exactly what they need. Per the company, its enterprise search platform understands context, language, behavior, and relationships with others and helps users find personalized answers to their questions. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Palo Alto, California.
Moveworks offers an autonomous artificial intelligence platform for resolving IT issues in the enterprise.

AlphaSense develops a market intelligence platform. The company's AI-based technology helps professionals make smarter business decisions by delivering insights from an extensive universe of public and private content, including company filings, event transcripts, expert call transcripts, news, trade journals, and equity research. AlphaSense was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in New York, New York.

Lucidworks builds AI-powered search solutions for various large brands. Fusion, Lucidworks' advanced development platform, provides the capabilities needed to design, develop, and deploy intelligent search applications at any scale. Companies across all industries, from consumer retail and healthcare to insurance and financial services, rely on Lucidworks every day to power their consumer-facing and enterprise search apps.

Sinequa is an independent software vendor providing an AI-powered search & analytics platform for Global 2000 companies and government agencies that connects people with the information and insights necessary for organizations to become information-driven.

Stravito is a knowledge technology company that operates in the cloud services and consumer business sectors. The company offers a user-friendly insights platform that simplifies knowledge management by securely storing and sharing market research and sales data across an organization. Stravito primarily serves decision-makers in consumer businesses. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

Coveo uses AI and intelligent search technologies to personalize millions of digital experiences for customers, partners, dealers, and employees. Coveo combines unified content, unified interactions and machine learning to deliver relevant information and recommendations across every business interaction, making websites, commerce, contact centers, intranets and digital properties and apps effortless, content-rich and effective.

Onna is a central access point for enterprise apps for users to find information in one place (legal discovery, compliance, knowledge management and enterprise search) regardless of where it is originally stored. It gives customers an open API to integrate any data source, drop in any ML model and finally connect to any workflow or application.

Dashworks operates as a search engine platform. It builds a search tool that brings together all of the information from various collaboration tools and databases. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Algolia provides a search engine as a service for enterprise search headless e-commerce mobile and app search, and voice search. It offers products such as algolia Search for relevant search and discovery and algolia Recommend for recommended searches. It caters its solution to e-commerce, B2B e-commerce marketplaces, media, and SaaS Industries. Algolia products integrate with Salesforce, Netlify, Shopify and more. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Hebbia specializes in AI-driven document workflow solutions within the technology sector. The company offers an AI interface that enables users to interact with large language models (LLMs) for efficient collaboration and data analysis across extensive document sets. Hebbia primarily serves large enterprises, financial institutions, governments, and law firms with its AI applications. It was founded in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.

Vectara is a semantic search software company. It uses neural search technology, providing increases in search relevance when compared with keyword-based algorithms. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Cupertino, California.

Quickwit is an open-source search engine built explicitly for object storage. It offers search on object storage with sub-second latency, an ingest and aggregation API that is Elasticsearch compatible, cloud-native strict schema indexing, a log management solution, and more. It was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Hex is building a data science platform that aims to allow users to build and collaborate on analyses, and turn them into data-driven apps, backed by powerful logic and deep connections to data. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.
