It aims to transform data-parallel computing with a proprietary Photonic Fabric technology platform that uses light for data movement both within the chip and between chips. Its system delivers differentiated single-node performance, providing performance for multi-node and multi-model applications. Celestial AI was formerly known as Inorganic Intelligence. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in... See More
Blaize offers transformative solutions that optimize AI wherever data is collected and processed from the edge to the core, with a focus on automotive, smart vision and enterprise computing markets.

Groq develops the Tensor Streaming Processor. TSP houses a single enormous processor that has hundreds of functional units. The architecture reduces instruction-decoding overhead, and handles integer and floating-point data, which delivers better accuracy for inference and training.

Graphcore provides AI systems and services that enable organizations to build, train and deploy their models in the cloud using the IPU hardware. Its products include cloud IPUs, data center IPUs, Bow IPU, and Poplar. The company serves the finance, biotech, scientific research, and consumer internet sectors. Graphcore was founded in 2016 and is based in Bristol, U.K.

Mobileye (NASDAQ: MBLY) provides Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) for autonomous public transport or goods delivery. It offers mapping technology, road experience management, responsibility-sensitive safety, camera system view, and radar and lidar system view. The company was founded in 1999 and is based in Jerusalem, Israel.
Intellifusion produces an artificial intelligence chip to perform visual recognition and big data analysis.

Lightmatter develops a light-powered chip designed to speed up artificial intelligence-driven computations by orders of magnitude. It uses integrated optical technology to create efficient processors and accelerate critical operations in neural networks using an array of programmable photonic elements fabricated alongside transistors in conventional CMOS processes. Its technology enables clients to get quality evaluations as well as low power consumption for the software algorithms underlying image recognition and natural language processing. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Cambricon (688256. SZ) is developing a brain-inspired processor chip that simulates human nerve cells and synapses to conduct deep learning. Its products include Siyuan 290, Siyuan 370 series, Siyuan 270 series, Xuansi 1000 Intelligent Accelerator, and Siyuan 220 series. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Beijing, China.
SambaNova Systems is a software-defined analytics platform that enables optimal performance for ML training, inference, and analytics models.

Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) designs, manufactures and sells computer components and related products. The company's major products include microprocessors, chipsets, embedded processors and microcontrollers, flash memory, graphic, network and communication, systems management software, conferencing, and digital imaging products. The company was founded in 1968 and is based in Santa Clara, California.
Hailo makes specialized deep learning processors to deliver data center performance to edge devices.

Cerebras is a computer systems company dedicated to accelerating deep learning. The Wafer-Scale Engine (WSE), is at the heart of the deep learning system, the Cerebras CS-1. The WSE delivers more computing more memory, and more communication bandwidth. This enables AI research at high speeds and scale.
Credo (NASDAQ: CRDO) provides high-performance serial connectivity solutions for the hyper-scale datacenter, 5G carrier, enterprise networking, AI, and high-performance computing markets.

Exafunction is building serverless infrastructure that abstracts away the challenges of deep learning. The companys platform offers GPU virtualization that can offload any workload, allowing customers to run their most challenging models with fewer resources and greater speed. It was founded in 2021 and is based in San Jose, California.

CoreWeave develops cloud infrastructure designed to supply projects and blockchain with computer power. The firm offers a solution that streamlines the team's operations. It also gives customers access to compute resources that are appropriate for the complexity of the models, allowing them to scale effectively and respond to fast-changing computing requirements. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Springfield, New Jersey.

Paperspace is a high-performance cloud computing and deep learning development platform for building, training and deploying models. Tens of thousands of individuals, startups, and enterprises use Paperspace to iterate faster and collaborate on intelligent, real-time prediction engines.

Together operates a decentralized cloud-based platform by providing open-source generative artificial intelligence (AI) models. The platform utilizes AI-based algorithms to enable researchers, developers, and companies to deploy their projects by combining data, models, and computation. The platform develops projects including generative pre-trained transformer model (GPT-J), OpenChatKit, and RedPajama, and more. It was founded in 2022 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Scaleway is a company that focuses on providing cloud services in the technology industry. Its main offerings include a range of cloud services such as serverless architectures, containerization, and bare metal solutions, as well as managed databases and storage solutions. The company primarily serves businesses in various sectors, including startups and companies in the tech industry. It was founded in 2013 and is based in Paris, France.

Modal is a platform that provides a solution for cloud-based encryption. The platform enables users to write and run code in the cloud and launch custom containers. The platform enables users to either define a container environment in the code or leverage the pre-built backend. Its features include monitoring, distributed queues, live logs, and more. It was founded in 2021 and is based in New York, New York.

Coiled products ensure that data infrastructure scales at maximum speed, minimum cost, and with the Python tools data scientists already use. Coiled makes it easy for teams and organizations to collaborate and ensures reproducibility with data of any size and simplifies working in the cloud.

Anyscale is the developer of Ray Open Source, a unified compute framework for scalable computing. Ray Open Source is an open-source, unified, distributed framework to easily scale AI and Python applications. It enables developers to effortlessly scale any workload or application from a laptop to the cloud without the cost or expertise required to build complex infrastructure. Anyscale is a fully-managed, enterprise-ready unified compute platform that makes it easy to build, deploy, and manage scalable AI and Python applications using Ray, which allows organizations to bring AI products to market faster at significantly lower costs. The company was formerly known as Indigostack. Anyscale was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Banana provides machine learning (ML) model hosting as an application programming interface (API). Its platform makes it easier for users to compartmentalize and parse through information and also provides models as an API and hosts custom models, enabling developers to get their work done in a hassle-free manner. The company was formerly known as Booste and changed its name to Banana in March 2022. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California

HippoML provides GPU AI( Artificial intelligence) computation solutions. The company specializes in research and framework development for performance optimization and productionization. HippoML was founded in 2023 and is based in Kirkland, Washington.

Run:AI builds a virtualization layer for AI workloads. By abstracting workloads from the underlying infrastructure, Run:AI creates a shared pool of resources that can be provisioned on the fly, enabling full utilization of expensive GPU to compute. IT teams retain control and gain real-time visibility  including seeing and provisioning run-time, queuing, and GPU utilization  from a single web-based UI. This virtual pool of resources enables IT leaders to view, allocate, and compute resources across multiple sites.

Replicate runs machine learning models in the cloud. It allows people to share the machine learning models in a way that other people can use them. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Baseten makes going from machine learning models to production-grade applications fast and easy. With Baseten, data science and machine learning teams can ship full-stack ML applications without backend, frontend, or MLOps knowledge, enabling faster, smarter decision-making at their organizations. It was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Cerebrium is a company specializing in serverless GPU infrastructure for machine learning within the cloud computing industry. The company offers a platform that allows users to run machine learning models in the cloud with scalable and performant serverless GPUs, only charging for the actual compute usage. Cerebrium's services are utilized by various sectors, including companies with stringent data privacy requirements and those seeking to reduce cloud computing costs. It was founded in 2021 and is based in London, England.

Inference.ai provides Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) for AI and machine learning applications within the technology sector. The company offers a diverse range of GPU resources for tasks such as model training and inferencing. It was founded in 2024 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Gradient focuses on artificial intelligence and technology. It provides a platform for customizing and deploying artificial intelligence systems, allowing users to build with private models and control their functions. The company's services are primarily used in the tech industry. It was founded in 2022 and is based in San Francisco, California.
Making ML aims to improve efficiency of neural network training with algorithmic methods that deliver speed, boost quality and reduce cost.

Beam helps developers build machine learning-powered applications. The platform allows users to run their code on serverless graphics processing units (GPUs), deploy highly performant Application Programming Interfaces (APIs), and prototype machine learning (ML). It primarily serves the technology industry. Beam was formerly known as Slai. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Lambda is a company focused on providing computation solutions in the technology sector. The company offers a range of products, including GPU clouds, clusters, servers, and workstations designed to accelerate deep learning and AI processes. Lambda primarily serves sectors such as research, defense, and entertainment. It was founded in 2012 and is based in San Jose, California.

Axelera AI develops hardware and software platforms for artificial intelligence (AI). Its solutions aim to enhance performance and efficiency to accelerate AI inference at the edge. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

Deeplite is an AI software company dedicated to enabling AI for everyday life. Deeplite uses AI to automatically make other AI models faster, smaller and more energy-efficient creating highly compact, high-performance deep neural networks for deployment on edge devices such as cameras, sensors, drones, phones, and vehicles.

Mythic develops a local artificial intelligence (AI) platform. It offers solutions for smart cities and spaces, intelligent machines and robots, smart homes, metaverse, drones, and aerospace industries. The company was formerly known as Isocline Engineering. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Austin, Texas.

Armada focuses on edge computing, artificial intelligence, and mobile data centers. It offers a full-stack edge computing platform that enables rapid deployment, operation, and monitoring of data centers in remote areas of the world. The company primarily serves industries that require real-time infrastructure and data processing. It was founded in 2023 and is based in Greenbrae, California.

Syntiant uses low power semiconductors to move machine learning from the cloud to the edge device enabling artificial intelligence for sensor, voice, and video applications in most battery-powered products. The company has put its technology to work developing more intelligent hearing aids. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Irvine, California.

SiMa.ai is a machine learning company offering a software-centric MLSoC platform. It makes software and hardware run AI algorithms on devices like industrial robots, drones, security cameras, and self-driving cars. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Jose, California.

Qeexo develops machine-learning solutions for mobile devices, touch interfaces, and embedded systems. The company's products include FingerSense, a touch technology solution that distinguishes between the fingertip, knuckle, nail, and stylus. It serves the mobile, IoT, and automotive industries. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Mountain View, California. In January 2023, Qeexo was acquired by TDK. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Edge Impulse enables developers to create intelligent device solutions with embedded machine learning on devices for sensors, audio, and computer vision at scale. It enables developers to use sensor, audio, and camera data in asset tracking and monitoring, human interfaces, and predictive maintenance applications. The company caters to the agriculture, appliances, buildings, environment, health, industry, infrastructure, and wearables sectors. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in San Jose, California.

Nota AI provides a software optimization platform. The platform provides a range of solutions including transportation systems and low-powered driver monitoring systems. It reduces the time and resources required to develop an artificial intelligence (AI) model and optimizes it for the target device assisting by democratizing its use across industries and applications. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Seoul, South Korea.

Quora operates a question and answer platform in the Internet services industry. The company's main service is to facilitate the sharing of knowledge on a range of topics, from politics to painting, cooking to coding, and more. It was founded in 2009 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Writer provides AI-driven copyediting for content teams. Writer's corrections are based on the user's own messaging and terminology, making writing more consistent across the entire company. From vocabulary and clarity to grammar and spelling, Writer provides additional content corrections that improve writing across the team.
Midjourney is an independent research lab. It produces a proprietary artificial intelligence program that creates images from textual descriptions. It is based in San Francisco, California.

Baidu (SEHK: 9888) delivers a search engine focusing on Chinese language search. It also provides users with many channels with forums, news, map, translation service, academics, music, cloud storage, mobile applications, and more. The company was founded in 2000 and is based in Beijing, China.

Apollo.io is a data intelligence and sales engagement platform. The platform helps sales professionals to find their ideal buyers by providing key contact details including direct dial phone numbers, up-to-date business emails, job titles, and more. It was formerly known as ZenProspect. It was founded in 2015 and is based in Covina, California.

Toplyne operates as a product-led platform. It helps revenue teams at product-led software-as-a-service (SaaS) companies to convert freemium users to paid subscribers. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Singapore.

Collective[i] is a company that focuses on B2B commerce, operating primarily in the artificial intelligence and sales technology sectors. The company offers services that automate CRM data entry and forecasting, provide data-driven insights, and connect relevant individuals to boost revenue growth. Its primary market is the B2B sales industry. It is based in New York, New York.

Attention is a company that focuses on providing artificial intelligence solutions for sales, operating within the technology and sales industries. The company offers a range of services including real-time coaching for sales representatives, automatic CRM updates after sales calls, and the drafting of intelligent follow-up emails based on previous conversations. Attention primarily serves the sales sector, providing tools and resources to help sales teams improve their performance and close deals more efficiently. It was founded in 2021 and is based in New York, New York.

Twain is an artificial intelligence (AI) communication assistant. Twain's editor allows users to paste their outreach messages and suggest changes to the message's opener, body, and closing. It helps sales and marketing teams increase their conversion rates. Twain was founded in 2021 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

Databook's Customer Intelligence Platform accelerates enterprise sales performance at scale with three integrated products: Databook Intent Dashboard, Databook Insights Platform, and Databook Sales Decks. Databook Intent Dashboard improves Marketing-to-Sales performance while decreasing costs by helping customer-facing teams prioritize the companies most likely to buy. The Databook Insights Platform accelerates qualified pipeline and top-line growth by delivering strategic value and offering a hyper-personalized customer experience. Databook Sales Decks increase sales organization productivity at scale by enabling 1-click, dynamic, and empathic customer content that delivers to the customer's perspective.

SalesLoft develops sales intelligence software that works in Salesforce and other CRM tools to help sales professionals engage with clients and prospects in a deeper, more meaningful way. Its platform offers cadence, automation, dialer, messenger and more features. It is based in Atlanta, Georgia.

Outreach provides a platform for business sales communication, featuring enterprise-grade bidirectional CRM integration, safety and security features, activity analytics, and predictive communication intelligence. The platform manages all customer interactions across email, voice and social, and leverages machine learning to guide reps to take the right actions.

HeadsUp operates a conversion engine for product-led sales. Its platform predicts conversion probability through ML analysis of product usage patterns and other indicators. The firm was founded in 2020 and is based in Vienna, Virginia.

Involve AI focuses on providing data-driven insights in the business domain. The company offers customer intelligence from data along with an early warning dashboard backed by artificial Intelligence models, enabling businesses to reduce churn, increase upsells and help in the customer experience. It primarily serves the business sector. Involve AI was formerly known as Glipped. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Santa Monica, California.

Aviso offers software as a service (SaaS) that provides predictive analytics designed to help sales teams optimize their performance and exceed their revenue goals. Aviso transforms and automates tedious sales forecasting processes with an easy-to-use, secure cloud application using a combination of machine learning algorithms and portfolio management techniques. Aviso Insights delivers a powerful data-driven decision-making framework to prioritize deals, deploy resources, and mitigate risks, driving revenue growth for small and large enterprises.

Unify is a company that focuses on providing solutions for go-to-market teams, operating within the technology and sales sector. The company offers a range of services including understanding buyer intent, finding contacts, and sending AI-personalized emails, all aimed at enhancing outbound sales efforts. Unify primarily caters to growth, marketing, and sales teams across various industries. It was founded in 2023 and is based in San Francisco, California.

MadKudu provides business-to-business (B2B) and software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions. Its predictive scoring solution analyzes marketing, product, and sales data to surface the prospects in the targeted company's database which helps the go-to-market (GTM) team to have prime insights with them. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Mountain View, California.

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) provides a customer relationship management (CRM) platform. It offers a range of software products to help businesses grow such as marketing automation software, customer service software, content management software, and more. It was founded in 2006 and is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

People.ai is a predictive sales management platform. People.ai is helping companies improve the performance of sales teams by surfacing insights and providing automated recommendations about coaching, ramping and activity analytics across their sales organization.

Clari is a mobile-first sales productivity platform. Clari combines mobile, intuitive design and data science to help sales teams close deals faster, reduce manual reporting and gain insight into deal progress. With Clari, sales reps have a mobile, easy-to-use window into all their sources with content organized around the two things that matter most: their deals and their relationships. At the same time, managers and sales operations teams have their first real-time view into deal progress, allowing them to coach reps in time to exceed quarterly goals, assign sales support resources more effectively, and apply science and data to optimize sales practices.

CloseFactor develops enterprise software to offer automated sales research and contextual insights. The company's technology harvests actionable and relevant information about companies from various sources using natural language processing (NLP) and information extraction techniques. It was formerly known as Ogmagod. CloseFactor was founded in 2019 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Salesform specializes in lead routing in business technology. The company offers a solution that qualifies, routes and converts inbound leads, providing easy installation, no-code data queries, and robust notifications. It primarily serves the sales and marketing sectors of the economy. It was founded in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.

Gong helps B2B sales teams convert more of their pipeline into closed revenue by shining the light on their sales conversations. Gong records, transcribes, and analyzes all sales calls, demos, and meetings so that sales teams can scale the effectiveness of their sales conversations.

Lavender develops an AI email assistant to help produce better-selling emails in a shorter amount of time. Its email assistant tool suggests new sentences and ways to make emails impactful. It combines AI recommendations and reply optimization with additional tools, such as gifs, spelling, grammar, spam check, subject line analysis, and prospect and company research, enabling salespersons to write efficient business emails. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.

Telescope develops an automated sales prospecting platform. It constantly monitors and improves a salesperson's outreach. It uses a machine learning-based collaborative filtering approach that collects and leverages information from multiple companies for salespeople to find the right clients and spend more time closing deals. Telescope was founded in 2021 and is based in London, United Kingdom.

Regie helps sales, marketing, and success teams write engaging content faster using AI. Its software blends language and AI to create, test, and analyze personalized sales campaigns. It offers sales, workplace, marketing, content management, outbound prospecting, inbound lead response, mid-cycle follow-up, and other solutions. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Conversica provides Intelligent Virtual Assistants for customer engagement. By automating routine business conversations and personalizing interactions at scale, Conversica augments the workforce allowing business professionals and AI Assistants to work together harmoniously. The flagship Conversica Sales AI Assistant helps companies find and secure customers more quickly and efficiently by automatically contacting, engaging, qualifying, and following up with leads via natural, multi-channel, and two-way conversations. With its library of purpose-built and ready-to-use conversational skills backed by its patented conversational AI platform, Conversicas AI Assistants can be deployed quickly and are human-like and personal. Conversica was founded in 2007 and is based in Foster City, Califor

Clay specializes in data enrichment and automation solutions. It offers services that combine data from different providers, real-time web scraping, and artificial intelligence to create personalized campaigns that facilitate more business meetings. The company primarily serves sectors that require outbound marketing and lead generation. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Brooklyn, New York.

Clearbit provides a collection of APIs designed to help businesses grow by turning partial information into full contact data, looking up company data by domain name, helping with OFAC compliance and screening, and providing address auto-complete and verification.

Copysmith provides a SaaS content creation platform to help in the process of writing content. The platform uses machine learning technology to understand human text and also features a built-in character counter for advertisements, landing pages, and plagiarism checkers. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

NextRoll, formerly AdRoll, provides digital marketing services. The company offers marketing platforms to create personalized, digital campaigns, and APIs for businesses to build their own marketing products.

Jasper is an AI content platform that helps teams create content for social media, advertising, articles, emails, websites, and art. The platform enables teams to create high-converting marketing copy, brainstorm new ideas, collaborate, and create content in a wide range of languages. Jasper was formerly known as Proof Technologies. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Austin, Texas.

Lately offers an online platform for video, audio, and social posts to get engagement. It develops an artificial intelligence (AI) content generator that atomizes any interview, webinar, conference panel, podcast, blog, word document, and newsletter into lead-generating social posts. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Stone Ridge, New York.
Copy.AI develops an artificial intelligence copywriter that enables users to create marketing copy in seconds.
Bluecore offers personalized retention emails for e-commerce firms. Bluecore automatically determines which emails to send in real-time.

Lily AI uses AI to help brands and retailers understand the individual customers emotional context. Lily AI combines deep product tagging with deep psychographic analysis to determine the active state of mind of each shopper and turns that into timely personalized interactions. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) operates a Customer Lifecycle Marketing platform company that integrates Big Data, proprietary technology and analytics to help brands acquire, grow and retain customers. The company's set of Data, Email, Social, Display, Search and Mobile solutions are used globally by hundreds of Middle Market and Fortune 500 brands.

Writesonic offers an AI-powered copywriting tool that generates marketing content for any business. It helps professionals to scale content production and output. The company develops ChatSonic, a tool to create engaging content. Writesonic was founded in 2021 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Dreamdata uses tracking and integrations to offer attribution and lead scoring for B2B companies. The startup aims to help its clients vet all revenue-related data in order to present an analysis of which activities are effectively driving sales, enabling them to grow faster. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Re:cast AI is a technology company focused on the content creation and marketing industry. The company offers a platform that enables users to generate unique, on-brand content for marketing purposes, including digital ads, social media posts, and product imagery. Re:cast AI primarily serves sectors such as marketing, advertising, and design. It is based in Singapore, Singapore.

Loops offers an email platform for modern software-as-a-service (SaaS) businesses. It enables businesses to send email newsletters, automated messages, and one-off campaigns through a single interface. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Beaverton, Oregon.

Attentive is an advertising services company. It provides marketing automation, growth marketing, retention marketing, audience management, messaging, and business intelligence. The company allows retail and e-commerce brands to connect with consumers through personalized communication experiences. Attentive was founded in 2016 and is based in Hoboken, New Jersey.

Invoca is an AI-powered call tracking and conversational analytics company that brings the depth of marketing analytics traditionally limited to digital consumer interactions to the world of human-to-human selling. Marketers use Invoca to maximize the return of their paid media campaigns on Google and Facebook and improve the buying experience by enriching customer profiles in Salesforce and Adobe. It was founded in 2008 and is based in Santa Barbara California.

6sense's helps revenue teams uncover anonymous buying behavior, prioritize fragmented data to focus on accounts in the market, and engage resistant buying teams with personalized, omni-channel, multi-touch campaigns. 6sense helps revenue teams know everything they need to know about their buyers so they can easily do anything they need to do to generate more opportunities, increase deal size, get into opportunities sooner, compete and win more often.

Persado is a provider in marketing persuasion technology, a new category within digital marketing. Persado's platform generates persuasive language for communications designed to drive action. The software uses semantic algorithms to map emotions and generate language for marketing communications such as emails, landing pages, mobile, push notifications and social media. By breaking down marketing language into emotional, descriptive, and formatting components, Persado's software linguistically engineers the optimal language, replacing the guesswork of copywriting.

ActiveCampaign helps businesses grow by strengthening their relationships with customers through utilizing a blend of automation and human touch. Companies are able to automate many behind-the-scene processes and communicate with customers across channels with personalized, intelligence-driven messages.

Bloomreach offers a suite of cloud-based software that connects both customer and product data to personalize customer touchpoints and enable revenue-driving, digital commerce experiences. Its Commerce Experience Cloud includes three product pillars: Discovery, which offers AI-driven search and merchandising; Content, which offers a headless content management system (CMS); and Engagement, which offers a customer data platform (CDP) and marketing automation solutions. Bloomreach serves commerce companies all over the world. It was founded in 2009 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Demandbase is an Account-Based Marketing (ABM) technology company. The company currently offers an Artificial Intelligence-enabled, comprehensive ABM platform that spans advertising, marketing, sales, and analytics.The company is active in multiple industries including, business services, enterprises, financial services, manufacturing, and technology. The company was founded in 2005 and is based in San Francisco, California.

DemandWell provides a digital marketing platform. It offers SEO service, content marketing, social media marketing, SEO strategy, marketing strategy, and other services. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Indianapolis, Indiana.

Mutiny helps business-to-business, software-as-a-service companies present a message that's customized to each visitor on their website. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Phrasee empowers brands with advanced, AI-powered copywriting technology. By generating human-sounding language thats always in a brands voice, Phrasee boosts marketing performance, revenue, and careers. Its technology generates and optimizes marketing copy for brands across retail, travel, financial services, and telecoms.

Pepper Content operates a content marketing platform. The platform helps businesses build a content team, create and manage content, and connect with the creators on its platform. It also offers a virtual content generation assistant. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Wilmington, Delaware.

Klaviyo helps to automate personalized e-mails and short message service (SMS) communications for brands. It operates as an intelligent marketing automation platform giving online brands direct ownership of their consumer data and interactions. Klaviyo was founded in 2012 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

AdCreative.ai is an AI-powered ad creation tool. Its platform generates social posts, text and headlines, and more. It serves e-commerce stores, startups, and marketing agencies. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Paris, France.

Appier (TSE: 4180) is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) company that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to provide business decision-making solutions. The company's products include CrossX, Aixpert, AiDeal, AIQUA, BotBonnie, and more. It caters to industries such as e-commerce, retail, finance, gaming, and automobile. The company was founded in 2012 and is absed in Taipei, Taiwan.

Rytr provides a writing tool designed to help users generate content. The company's platform uses various tools and templates to help write content for blogs, social media platforms, emails, and many other platforms. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Wilmington, Delaware. In October 2022, Rytr merged with Frase to create Copyrytr.

Braze (NASDAQ:BRZE) is a lifecycle engagement platform allowing mobile brands to manage the customer lifecycle beyond the download. Employing customer segmentation, multi-channel messaging (push notifications, in-app messages, email, and News Feed) and multivariate testing, brands can cultivate relationships with their user base.

Vendelux is an AI-Powered Event Intelligence Platform operating in the event technology sector. The company provides services that help event organizers and marketers generate leads and create meaningful networking connections at conferences. Its main offerings include data on speakers, sponsors, and attendees for over 50,000 trade shows and conferences. It was founded in 2021 and is based in New York, New York.

Typeface develops an enterprise-grade generative artificial intelligence (AI) application. The company assists all businesses in creating on-brand content. It was formerly known as Cortex6. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Customer.io offers a platform for flexibility and control over automated messages. It allows web or mobile application developers to send emails based on what users do within their applications. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Portland, Oregon.

Zendesk (NYSE: ZEN) focuses on customer service and sales, operating in customer relationship management (CRM). It offers a range of services including customer service solutions, sales solutions, and a flexible platform for apps and integrations. Its services are designed to facilitate conversations at scale, support growth for small and medium businesses, and help startups get started, among other functions. It was founded in 2007 and is based in San Francisco, California
LivePerson (NASDAQ: LPSN) aims to help companies with customer servicing, retention, and upselling via its LP Marketer, LP Chat, and LP Voice offerings.

Kasisto is a company that focuses on conversational artificial intelligence solutions, primarily in the banking and finance sector. The company offers a platform that provides intelligent digital assistants, designed to facilitate accurate, human-like conversations and empower teams with financial knowledge. Kasisto primarily serves global financial institutions, regional banks, community banks, and credit unions. It was founded in 2013 and is based in New York, New York.

Dashbot operates as an artificial intelligence (AI) based conversational data platform. It ingests, cleans, stores, and processes conversation data such as phone calls, customer service interactions, and social media chats. It provides insights for enterprise stakeholders, data science and analytics experts, and more. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Uniphore is a conversational service automation software company that enables businesses globally to deliver better customer service by providing an automation platform in which intelligent software can take over transactional conversations from humans, coach live agents during calls, and accurately predict language, emotion, and intent. It offers several products, such as X Platform, U-Self Serve, U-Assist, U-Analyze, and Q for Sales. The company was founded in 2008 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Ada offers an automated platform that integrates artificial intelligence and enables enterprise businesses around the world to automate customer service that saves time, reduces cost, and strengthens their support. It also offers different chatbots as per the need of the business. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Toronto, Canada.

Slang.ai develops a conversational AI platform designed to improve customer service operations for its clients. The company's platform leverages natural language processing technology to automate taking orders over phones and processing return orders. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in New York, New York
Kore.ai develops a bot-based messaging and conversational AI platform that deploys and manages secure conversational bots across 30 different digital and voice channels.

Sprinklr is a complete social media management platform for the enterprise, designed to help large companies collaborate across their entire organization to customer experiences across every social channel. The platform provides content planning and publishing, advocate and audience management, owned engagement and moderation, and earned monitoring and listening.

Sierra specializes in conversational AI within the customer experience sector. The company offers a platform that enables businesses to deploy AI agents capable of providing empathetic and sophisticated customer support around the clock. Sierra's AI agents are designed to engage with customers in real-time, solving complex issues and adapting to improve the customer experience continuously. It was founded in 2023 and is based in San Francisco, California.

MoEngage offers an intelligent marketing automation platform for consumer brands to understand customer behavior across digital touchpoints through inbuilt analytics and orchestrate personalized campaigns across multiple channels, including mobile, email, SMS, and website. MoEngage was founded in 2014 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Forethought aims to use artificial intelligence to help with customers service. It assists customer support employees with triaging tickets, finding answers to common issues, and training new hires. Forethought has 3 customer service products which include the Assist, Solve and Triage. Assist aims to help customer service associates (CSAs) find the information they need to solve a problem quickly,. Solve is a chatbot that answers simple questions and routes complex queries to human CSAs. Per the company, Triage uses AI to route calls to the most knowledgeable CSAs.

Netomi is an AI platform for customer service that allows businesses to activate, manage, and train AI to automatically resolve tickets, enhance agent productivity, and provide customer experience. The company works with global retail, travel & hospitality, telecommunications, finance, and insurance companies, including WestJet, Nestle, and Singtel.

Observe.ai is an enterprise AI company that leverages deep learning and NLP to automate support workflows. The company empowers call center agents to do their jobs better. Its voice AI platform provides the agent with real-time feedback on customer sentiment and guides them on next steps during the customer call.

Ask-AI provides a generative artificial intelligence (AI) platform for natural language processing. It offers a generative AI solution that aggregates and analyzes company knowledge and customer communications, providing answers to natural language questions and revealing actionable insights. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

Typewise is a mobile app that allows users to install an alternative keyboard. It builds customized AI language models for each client, which includes company-specific vocabulary and learns which phrases have the highest business impact. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in Schlieren, Switzerland.

Afiniti is a multinational applied artificial intelligence company. Afiniti uses AI to identify and predict subtle, valuable patterns of human behavior to better pair customers and employees. Pairing in this way results in higher quality interpersonal interactions and drives measurable increases in revenue and customer lifetime value for enterprises.

Dialpad develops an artificial intelligence (AI) powered cloud communications platform. It provides a cloud-based platform for voice, messaging, video, and meetings. It helps in customer engagement, business communication, customer intelligence platform, and more. Dialpad was formerly known as Switch Communications. It was founded in 2011 and is based in San Ramon, California.

ASAPP is an artificial intelligence software that aims to help call center agents work better and faster. ASAPP software says it does not replace human call center agents, but instead analyzes the calls of a centers most efficient agent and then sends to all agents real-time suggestions of what to say in response to specific things said by customers. For web chats, it presents the agent with multiple potential responses that can be sent with a click. It was founded in 2014 and is based in New York, New York.

Ultimate is a provider in the customer support automation industry, leveraging conversational and generative AI to enhance customer service operations. The company offers products that automate customer support across various text-based communication channels, including chat and email and integrates with CRM systems to provide end-to-end automation solutions. It improves customer experience, increases efficiency, and supports multi-language interactions. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Berlin, Germany. In March 2024, Ultimate was acquired by Zendesk.

Drift is a conversational marketing and sales platform that focuses on B2B companies. It provides customer prospecting, customer service, target account engagement, visitor intelligence, and real-time personalization. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Frame Technology aims to improve customer acquisition, retention, and expansion with humanpowered conversations connected to existing services and data. It offers solutions to predict and prevent escalation, reduce case volume, and service cost, and also track customer effort. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Irvington, New York.

Maven AGI specializes in artificial intelligence (AI) solutions for enterprise customer support within the technology sector. The company offers AI-driven platforms to automate support workflows, enhance customer experiences through personalized support, and empower support agents with AI co-pilot capabilities. Its services cater to the needs of enterprise-level organizations seeking to improve their customer support operations. It was founded in 2023 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

CallMiner helps businesses and organizations improve contact center performance and gather key business intelligence by automating their ability to listen to every customer interaction. CallMiner's cloud-based voice of the customer analytics solution automatically analyzes contacts across all communication channels: calls, chat, email, and social. CallMiner offers both real-time monitoring and post-call analytics, delivering insights to contact center staff, business analysts, and executives.

Yellow.ai is a Conversational CX Automation Platform that brings AI and human intelligence together to automate customer experience for large brands and enterprises. Yellow.ai was founded in 2016 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Cresta uses AI to turn sales and service agents into experts on day one, elevating the customer experience and growing the business. The company codifies the psychology, behavior, and language that top contact center agents use to achieve successful outcomes. Once this expertise is learned, Cresta re-distributes it to every agent in real-time, effectively turning every agent into an immediate expert.

Certainly is a generative AI company that specializes in conversational AI solutions within the customer service automation sector. The company offers a platform for creating AI chatbots that can engage with customers, automate support, and integrate with various ecommerce tools. These chatbots are designed to enhance customer experience, provide multilingual support, and offer real-time insights into customer interactions. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Intercom is a fundamentally new way for internet businesses to communicate with customers, personally, at scale. It's a customer communication platform with a suite of integrated products for every team-including sales, marketing, product, and support. Intercom's products enable communication with customers on your website, inside your web and mobile apps, and by email.

Genesys provides customer service and contact center software and services. Its software directs interactions every day, from the contact center to the back office. It offers workforce engagement, artificial intelligence (AI) and automation, customer journey management, and more. It serves retail, healthcare, financial services, government, and other sectors. It was founded in 1990 and is based in Menlo Park, California.

Dovetail offers a flexible customer insights platform for teams to get data-driven insights. Its platform stores user research notes, transcripts, images, videos, and audio recordings and discovers patterns across research data collected from interviews, usability testing, and customer interviews. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Sydney, Australia.

Visier develops business support software. It specializes in creating workforce analytic applications through the cloud for human resource management. The company was founded in 2010 and is based in Vancouver, Canada.

Textio provides an artificial intelligence platform that analyzes business documents as they're being written to forecast and improve their performance. The company's first product, Textio Talent, optimizes job listings, recruiting email, and other talent content.
Eightfold.ai offers a talent intelligence platform. It allows the user to centralize all their people data, including ATS, HRMS, resume books, and spreadsheets.

Gloat develops a system based on artificial intelligence and analyzes the possible career paths in the organization and the achievements and abilities of each employee. Employees can enter their skills, professional experiences, and achievements throughout their careers throughout the company, and then proactively receive various career development opportunities. Gloat was formerly known as Workey. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in New York, New York.

Lattice is a performance management solution for growing companies, aimed at increasing employee retention. Lattice's products are designed to help mid-market customers with goal OKR management, performance reviews, employee feedback and manager-employee conversations. The product covers the full breadth of a performance management cycle.

The Predictive Index (PI), formerly PI Worldwide, is a workforce assessment platform used to define behavioral and cognitive job requirements, hire candidates, and keep them engaged. It aligns business strategy with people strategy for optimal business results. The solution aims to enable companies to design teams and cultures, make objective hiring decisions, and foster engagement. The company serves clients in the United States. It was founded in 1995 and is based in Westwood, Massachusetts.

Scribe develops a workflow documentation platform to analyze, optimize, and standardize processes for the documentation of information. It onboards new employment creates standard operating procedures (SOPs), builds training materials, and more. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Harver is a pre-employment assessment platform for hiring at scale. Its platform is designed to remove the challenges surrounding high-volume hiring, including managing large volumes of applicants, mitigating unconscious bias, and capturing the right information upfront to make data-driven hiring decisions. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in New York, New York. In May 2021, Harver was acquired by OutMatch. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

PandoLogic is focused on the online recruitment industry, building an effective recruitment advertising network designed to connect employers and job seekers more efficiently, while helping digital publishers increase revenue and site traffic with online recruitment. On July 22nd, 2021, PandoLogic was acquired by Veritone at a valuation of $150M.

Beamery uses large-scale, data-mining, and machine-learning algorithms to automate relationship tracking for recruiters. It builds recruitment CRM software that enables companies to approach recruiting like customer acquisition,Â­ from outbound prospecting and pipeline building to targeted nurture and engagement. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in London, U.K.

SeekOut focuses on talent acquisition and management in the human resources industry. The company offers services such as finding suitable candidates for open roles, helping organizations build diverse talent pipelines, and providing insights for workforce planning. It assists in promoting internal mobility and upskilling or reskilling existing employees. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Bellevue, Washington.

Moonhub provides a recruiter-on-demand platform powered by artificial intelligence (AI). Its platform combines public and internal data points to help teams discover and engage candidates for any job opportunity. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Menlo Park, California.
HireVue provides an assessment and video interviewing platform that combines video, AI, game, and technical challenges for comprehensive hiring intelligence.

Fetcher operates a staffing and recruiting platform that combines artificial intelligence and human expertise to fill positions quicker. Rather than using a standard database model, Fetcher's unique combination of machine learning and human intelligence creates curated batches of candidates for every open role. This sourcing model allows recruiters to spend less time in front of a computer searching or filtering for candidates, and more time connecting with candidates and hiring managers. Fetcher serves the staffing and recruiting industry. Fetcher was founded in 2015 and is based in New York, New York.

StepStone is an independent online recruitment site, publishing job opportunities across Europe every day, and offering recruiters a range of services to help fill their vacancies with quality people, quickly and efficiently.
Turing helps source, vet, and ultimately connect developers with tech companies that need them for either short- or long-term engagements.

Entelo allows recruiters to search for software engineers and designers across the social web. With social profiles, search, and technology to discover candidates who may be open to new opportunities, Entelo improves the ability to find the right talent at the right time.

AntWorks is an in Intelligent Document Processing and Automation Company. It uses proprietary Artificial Intelligence technology to unlock, classify and digitize the vital data in the full range of business documents. Its flagship product, CMR+, understands and contextualizes information with minimal intervention. It also processes hard-to-read, complex, unstructured content; emails, contracts, reports, tables, images and handwriting. AntWorks provides a platform that integrates artificial intelligence and cognitive process automation to provide smart solutions for enterprises. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Singapore, Singapore.

ABBYY is a global provider of AI and language-based technologies. It empowers organizations to gain a complete understanding of their business processes and the content that fuels them with its Digital Intelligence platform.

Ocrolus operates as an automation platform that analyzes financial documents. Ocrolus is powered by a blend of AI and crowdsourced human quality control, enabling firms across the financial sector to automate high-stakes business processes. Ocrolus uses a combination of technology, including OCR (optical character recognition), machine learning/AI and big data to analyze financial documents. Per the company, its technology can classify financial documents, capture key data fields, detect fraud and analyze cash flows. Ocrolus started with the intent to automate the long-term care Medicaid application process.

Axiom.ai is a company that focuses on Robotic Process Automation (RPA) in the technology industry. The company offers a no-code browser automation service, allowing users to automate website actions and repetitive tasks on any website or web app. Axiom.ai primarily serves the technology sector with its automation solutions. It was founded in 2018 and is based in London, United Kingdom.
JIFFY.ai helps companies automate tasks that are usually performed manually through robotic process automation (RPA).

UiPath (NYSE: PATH) is a New York-based, robotic process automation (RPA) company that helps in the training and collaboration of AI and machine learning. The technology is used by companies in document management, contact center, healthcare, finance and accounting, human resources, and supply chains, addressing major technical challenges, including data extraction and migration, process automation, application integration, and business process outsourcing. The company was founded in 2005 and is based in New York, New York.

Kognitos develops an artificial intelligence (AI) platform that helps organizations with business processes. The company offers products such as language processing automation (NLPA) and Large language models (LLMs) to help business users in analyzing everyday workflows. Kognitos was founded in 2020 and is based in San Jose, California.

Hyperscience automates manual document processing for global financial services, insurance, healthcare, and government organizations. Its proprietary solution classifies documents and extracts data. Structured data files are then sent downstream for processing, decreasing wasted manual effort, and increasing output and productivity. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in New York, New York.

Workato is an enterprise automation platform that enables both business and IT teams to integrate their apps and automate business workflows without compromising security and governance. It enables companies to drive outcomes from business events. There is no coding required, and the platform utilizes machine learning and patented technology to make the creation and implementation of automation faster than traditional platforms. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in Mountain View, California.

DeepOpinion is an internal process automation platform for texts that enable enterprise teams to automate text-based processes. It focuses on tasks in the text and document area. This includes dealing with emails, customer support, ticketing, invoices, delivery notes, and order confirmations. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in Innsbruck, Austria.
Bardeen.ai is an automation app to replace repetitive tasks with a single shortcut and control web apps from anywhere. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Tungsten Automation specializes in intelligent automation and digital workflow transformation within the technology sector. The company offers artificial intelligence (AI)-powered software solutions that automate data-intensive workflows for various business-critical applications. Tungsten Automation was formerly known as Kofax. It was founded in 1985 and is based in Irvine, California.

Levity is a company that focuses on providing no-code artificial intelligence (AI) workflow automation solutions in the technology sector. The company offers a platform that enables businesses to automate manual tasks using AI, without the need for coding. This includes extracting essential information from text data, categorizing text data, generating text, and summarizing lengthy documents. The company primarily serves sectors that require automation of repetitive tasks, such as customer support and email management. It was founded in 2018 and is based in Berlin, Germany.

Luminai helps customer service organizations automate internal workflows by making any kind of multi-click process one click. It offers everyday work flows, streamlining processes, reducing time spent on tickets, and contributing to customer support. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Eigen Technologies is a natural language processing (NLP) company based in London and New York. The company enables organizations to unlock the value of their qualitative data by automating the extraction of text from documents using machine learning.
Rossum develops artificial intelligence that understands complex structured documents, enabling companies to capture data from financial documents efficiently and with human-level accuracy.

Orby AI develops an AI platform to bring the auto-complete experience to everyday business users and automate all mundane and repetitive tasks. Its platform democratizes the use of Generative AI to automate repetitive human processes. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Zapier allows its users to create connections between different web apps. Partners, including Salesforce, Intuit, Google, and Dropbox, utilize Zapier to offer their customers integrations with over 350 apps. The Zapier Developer Platform enables developers to add APIs for private or public use.

Instabase is a platform for businesses to build customizable apps for automating different parts of their business. For example, a bank can quickly build an app that can automatically verify customer income in a fraction of a second by combing through documents such as camera pictures or scans of paystubs, tax documents, bank statements, and other similar documents submitted by the customer. The platform comes equipped with the tools for reading documents, data extraction and classification, natural language processing, and optical character recognition. It is designed to enable creators, developers, and organizations to quickly build complex business applications based on their needs.

Celonis offers a process mining tool for analyzing and visualizing business processes. It helps organizations understand and improve operational process flows for business transformation. The company was founded in 2011 and is based in Munich, Germany.

Alkymi transforms enterprise workflows by placing machine learning and automation technology into the hands of business users, turning operational data headaches into a source of efficiency. Alkymis core products, Data Inbox and Patterns, allow businesses to extract, analyze, and take action on critical business data in emails and documents. Organizations deploy Alkymi to accelerate decision-making, improve customer satisfaction, and empower employees to focus on higher value work. Alkymi was founded in 2017 and is based in New York, New York.

Tonkean offers a digital platform featuring robotic automation for enterprises. Tonkean's platform acts as an operating system for operations teams and allows users to manage and streamline business processes, formulas and reporting with no-code.

buynomics offers a forecasting platform that helps companies digitize their prices under realistic conditions, and helps predict their purchase behavior in different circumstances. It integrates artificial intelligence that converts data into meaningful insights, observes the effects of competitors' actions, and the impact of pricing strategy to predict the purchasing pattern of the consumers. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Cologne, Germany.

Arena is a software firm that builds active learning systems and techniques, such as reinforcement learning. The company's platform leverages active learning agents that continually test, learn, and improve omnichannel sales strategies automatically. Arena helps CPG companies, small merchants, and technology companies transform intensive sales and supply chain processes into autonomous, self-learning systems, unlocking efficiencies and resulting in a better, more affordable consumer experience. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in New York, New York.

Nextmv is a developer platform for automating and optimizing decisions that drive business operations  from vehicle routing to workforce scheduling and more. With Nextmv's flexible APIs, developers can quickly build, test, and deploy decision services in modern technology stacks at speed and scale. Nextmv was founded in 2019 and is based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

paretos offers an end-to-end decision intelligence platform. Its platform makes data-driven decisions across entire organizations, enabling business users to evaluate complex data, predict future scenarios and take action. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Heidelberg, Germany.

Lyric is a security provider company. It provides both the efficiency of point solutions and the tailored benefits of a custom build. It applies products and tailored solutions, and through the creation of organization-specific IP with an expansive catalog of supply chain data, decisions, and predictions, enterprises are equipped to solve any problem. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Sunnyvale, California.
Peak is a data analytics-as-a-service company that helps businesses with data services using artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies.
Aera delivers technology that enables the Self-Driving Enterprise: a cognitive operating system that connects customers with their business and autonomously orchestrates their operations.

LinkSquares provides an AI contract analytics software designed to help legal and finance teams work smarter by simplifying contract management, analysis, and reporting. It offers solutions such as crisis management, contract review, contract storage, data privacy and compliance, and deal acceleration. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Eve focuses on providing artificial intelligence solutions for the legal profession. The company's main offerings include a personalized AI tool that assists with tasks such as document review, case analysis, and legal research, functioning as an additional team member who can be trained and taught. The company primarily serves the legal industry. It was founded in 2023 and is based in San Francisco, California.

EvenUp operates in the legal technology industry. The company provides artificial intelligence (AI)-driven services that transform medical documents and case files into demand packages for injury lawyers. These services primarily cater to the legal industry, particularly law firms specializing in personal injury cases. It was founded in 2019 and is based in San Francisco, California.

SpellBook fka Rally offers a generative artificial intelligence contract drafting and review tool built on top of LLMs. The product is focused on corporate and commercial lawyers in both law firms and companies and aims to provide suggested contract language and negotiation points. Spellbook, when it was Rally, initially aimed to provide an automation and collaboration platform for business lawyers and individual clients. It offered document automation, integration galore, stakeholder management, templates, e-signing workflow, and other services. It was founded in 2018 and is based in Toronto, Canada.

Casetext provides information and research services to litigation practices. The company's software, CARA, automates key legal research tasks by leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies to analyze litigation documents and uses that information to algorithmically query the law.

LexCheck offers Artificial intelligence (AI) platform that helps business transactions by automatically reviewing and revising pre-execution contracts. Its platform automatically makes substantive changes to contract language and is equipped to handle both first- and third-party paper. Also provides functionality for all levels of contract drafting and review, ranging from ordinary course commercial contracts to complex, high-stakes agreements. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in New York, New York.

DoNotPay is an AI-powered legal assistant bot. The company's Robo Revenge aims to automate the process of identifying the company behind each robocall, which gives users the ability to go after those companies under the 1991 Telephone Consumer Protection Act.

Harvey provides artificial intelligence (AI) solutions for lawyers to practice law. It provides lawyers with legal tools to help with their everyday workflows, from editing legal documents to performing legal research, through instructions and questions posed in natural language. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Playa Del Re, California.

Ironclad is a contract management software solution that aims to offer an automated assistant that manages legal paperwork for companies. It is one organized Dropbox folder for all legal documents, along with automated templates for NDAs, sales contracts, and contractors.

Reveal Data provides cloud-based eDiscovery software solutions and services. Its eDiscovery software platform offers the full range of processing, ECA, review and artificial intelligence capabilities.

TermScout is a legal-tech company that offers solutions for contract review services. It provides clients with competitive data to draft competitive contracts. Its platform enables clients to engage in a third-party contract review process. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Denver, Colorado.

Darrow operates as a legal data security platform. It develops an artificial intelligence (AI) based data engine that ingests large amounts of publicly-available documents to search for class action litigation potential across areas like data privacy violations and environmental contamination. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.

Robin AI provides an artificial intelligence (AI)-native platform. It offers modular software that empowers legal teams and lawyers to make the contract process. It offers services that enable the creation, review, and search of contracts. It was founded in 2019 and is based in London, United Kingdom.

Lexion focuses on contract management in the legal technology industry. The company offers a contract management system that helps streamline contract workflows, automate repeat work, and centralize contracts in one place using artificial intelligence (AI). It primarily sells to sectors such as sales, legal, procurement, human resources (HR), and information technology (IT). It was founded in 2018 and is based in Seattle, Washington.
ContractPodAi offers an end-to-end solution offering contract management services including for contract generation, contract repository, and third-party review.

Icertis is a cloud-based enterprise contract management platform that enables companies to accelerate their business by increasing contract velocity, protect against risk by ensuring regulatory and policy compliance and optimize commercial relationships by maximizing revenue and reducing costs. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Bellevue, Washington.

Pincites operates as an artificial intelligence (AI) for contract negotiation. It helps to generate contract playbooks that help legal teams negotiate contracts. It was founded in 2023 and is based in Campbell, California.

Paxton is a legal assistant AI that helps lawyers learn new areas of the law, quickly draft and compare documents and deepen discovery. It also conducts securities filings and regulatory searches. Paxton has been trained on over 60M+ legal documents including all published federal and state case law as well as all state and federal laws, as well as EDGAR from the SEC. Attorneys can upload their documents, audio and video files, to query or train Paxton. Paxton was founded in 2023 and is based in Palo Alto, California

DISCO is a legal technology company that applies artificial intelligence and cloud computing to legal problems to support lawyers and legal teams in improving legal outcomes for their clients. Its e-discovery solution is used by corporate legal departments, law firms, and government agencies for compliance, disputes, and investigations.

Relativity develops software to help users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. The company's e-discovery platform is used by organizations around the world to manage large volumes of data. It also offers a cloud solution product RelativityOne which manages large volumes of data and identifies key issues during litigation and internal investigations and compliance projects. The company was founded in 2001 and is based in Chicago, Illinois.

Everlaw offers a collaborative, cloud-based litigation platform for corporate counsels, litigators, and government attorneys that enables teams to discover, illuminate, and act on information to drive internal investigations and impact the outcome of litigation. Everlaw was formerly known as EasyESI. The company was founded in 2010 and is based in Oakland, California.

midpage offers an add-in that connects millions of legal documents to GPT4. It suggests case references, arguments, and answers questions. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Berlin, Germany.
Luminance, which spun out of the University of Cambridge, is an AI-powered, document analysis platform that aims to disrupt the legal due diligence process.

Reveal is a free platform for Partnership, Marketing, and Sales teams to generate revenue through their ecosystem. Reveal allows users to connect with companies from their ecosystem, securely compare their CRM data, and multiply up to 3X of their win rate thanks to their ecosystems insights. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in Paris, France.
Habu builds software applications for privacy-safe data sharing, real-time analytics, automated segmentation and optimization across all of the major cloud providers.
PartnerTap connects salespeople with prospects and their referral partners.

InfoSum provides data management and software services. It enables companies to understand a broader perspective of their customers' lives by joining siloed data sets and collaborating without the commercial and regulatory risks associated with centralized platforms. It offers customers across financial services, content distribution, connected television, eCommerce, gaming, and entertainment and compliantly connects their customer data to other partners through privacy-safe, data networks. InfoSum was founded in 2015 and is based in Basingstoke, U.K.
Vendia is a serverless, distributed platform that enables customers to share data and code across multiple clouds and companies.

WorkSpan is a co-sell management network that enables companies to charge and scale their co-sell revenue growth. The platform can be used by partnership and sales teams to collaborate with partners on deals, exchange co-sell referrals from inside their CRM, manage shared pipelines, and track performance on a live dashboard. The platform is designed primarily for technology companies. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in San Bernardino, California.

Crossbeam is a collaborative intelligence platform that helps companies build more valuable partnerships. It serves as an escrow service for data, allowing companies to find overlapping customers and prospects while keeping the rest of their data private and secure. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

PartnerStack provides a full-stack solution for partnerships. The company offers partner marketing, channel marketing, partner marketing software, channel marketing software, marketing automation software, co-marketing software, and marketing software. It is based in Toronto, Ontario.

Logically is a technology company that focuses on combating harmful and problematic online content, operating within the artificial intelligence and information technology sectors. The company offers services that utilize advanced AI and human expertise to identify and neutralize damaging and misleading information online, providing tools for individuals, businesses, and governments to ensure the integrity of information. Its primary market includes the public sector, defense and national security, and enterprise risk intelligence. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Brighouse, England.

Unitary develops contextual artificial intelligence (AI) to automate content moderation. It uses AI to read the context of user-generated videos uploaded to social media platforms and highlight content those are harmful to particular users or advertisers. It was founded in 2019 and is based in London, United Kingdom.

MinervaAI has an automated solution aimed to provide faster, smarter, and more compliant financial crime investigations, augmenting the human investigator and increasing investigator productivity with data aggregation, data curation, automation, documentation, and deep learning.

Fern.ai is a clinical evidence platform specializing in regulatory compliance for the life sciences sector. The company offers a suite of services that streamline the process of collecting, analyzing, and structuring clinical evidence for regulatory reports, leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) and natural language processing to enhance efficiency and accuracy. Fern.ai primarily serves regulatory bodies and medical technology companies, providing tools for systematic literature reviews, clinical evaluation reports, and post-market surveillance among other regulatory compliance needs. It was founded in 2023 and is based in Monroeville, Pennsylvania.

Weave.AI is a company that focuses on supply chain due diligence, ESG benchmarking, and investment stewardship, operating in the artificial intelligence and software as a service (SaaS) sectors. The company offers an end-to-end AI and SaaS solution that automates ESG due diligence and benchmarking, and helps companies and asset managers attract ESG capital. It also provides a platform for monitoring and assessing risks, benchmarking goals and practices, sifting through large amounts of data, and engaging stakeholders with actionable data insights. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Bellevue, Washington

Vanta operates as a trust management platform. The platform automates security assessments, provides insights into risk, and helps organizations communicate their security posture to customers, partners, and investors. It primarily serves the cybersecurity industry. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Greenlite operates an artificial intelligence (AI) compliance team for every fintech and bank. It develops AI agents for financial crime investigations. Its AI agents help financial technologies and banks automate workflows such as suspicious activity investigations, entity due diligence, and regulatory reporting. It was founded in 2023 and is based in San Francisco, California.
Hummingbird offers a platform for orchestrating and automating financial compliance programs.

Compliance.ai develops a Regulatory Change Management platform designed to mitigate risk, reduce costs, and increase confidence in compliance status for the banking, financial services, and insurance industries. Compliance.ai transforms the capabilities of compliance teams by delivering a simple-to-use, automated approach to monitoring and reacting to regulatory updates, identifying obligations, and ensuring required changes are completed in a timely manner. Through its flexible, intuitive platform, Compliance.ai helps compliance teams increase accuracy, improve productivity, and reduce compliance gaps. The company was formerly known as Jurispect. It was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Forter provides a plug-and-play, anti-eCommerce fraud solution technology that automates the review process by instantly analyzing profile data, behavioral data, and cyber intelligence, enabling the ability to decline fraudsters and approve consumers in real-time.

ComplyAdvantage helps firms make intelligent choices when complying with regulations relating to sanctions, money laundering (AML), terrorist financing (CFT), bribery, and corruption. Its database of individuals, organizations, and associated entities provides real-time insight into financial crime risks. ComplyAdvantage uses artificial intelligence, machine learning, and big data analytics combined with a tailored risk-based approach to help firms not only to manage their compliance and risk obligations, but also to prevent the occurrence of financial crime.

Norm Ai focuses on revolutionizing regulatory compliance through the use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the legal and compliance industry.
