The company's precision medicine platform aims to enable medical insights for drug discovery and development by connecting life sciences firms with academic researchers and hospitals. The Owkin platform aims to enable partners to uncover siloed datasets while maintaining patient privacy and securing proprietary data using Federated Learning and

Atropos Health develops a physician consultation service. It uses anonymized patient records and aims to help providers answer clinical questions that have fallen through the cracks of the evidence-based literature. Atropos Health empowers research and effective care delivery by leveraging insights from free-text notes and other non-standard data entries. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in New York.

Schrodinger provides advanced molecular simulations and enterprise software solutions and services for life sciences and materials research. Schrodinger also establishes partnerships and collaborations with companies in such fields as biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and electronics, and helped found the biotech company Nimbus Therapeutics.

Insilico Medicine develops a range of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and reinforcement learning approaches to identify protein targets, generate molecular structures with specified properties, and generate synthetic data. The company provides pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies with artificial intelligence solutions for research and development. It was founded in 2014 and is based in Hong Kong.

DNAnexus, a multiomics platform, is creating scalable and collaborative data technologies to unlock the potential of DNA-based medicine and biotechnology. The company has created a cloud-based DNA data management and biomedical data analysis platform that provides instant online genomics data centers for researchers and sequencing service providers alike.
Verana Health assembles clinical databases in medicine to empower physicians and accelerate research for patients. The databases produce drug lifecycle and medical practice insights.

ArsenalBio builds a programmable cell therapy solution to create effective and accessible immune cell therapies to impact outcomes for a much broader number of patients, initially those with cancer. ArsenalBio is focused on integrating technologies such as CRISPR-based genome engineering, scaled and high throughput target identification, synthetic biology, and machine learning to advance a new paradigm to discover and develop immune cell therapies. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in South San Francisco, California.
Benchling is an informatics platform to accelerate, measure, and forecast R&D from discovery through bioprocessing. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in San Francisco, California.

SOPHiA Genetics (NASDAQ:SOPH) is a health tech company which focuses on data-driven medicine as the standard of care and for life sciences research. It develops a cloud-based SaaS platform capable of analyzing data and generating insights from complex multimodal data sets. It develops SOPHiA AI, an advanced technology which analyzes and detects all types of genomic variants to help clinicians better diagnose and treat their patients. The company was founded in 2011 and is based in Saint Sulpice, Switzerland.

JADBio operates as a company focusing on providing automated machine learning (AutoML) solutions in the life sciences sector. The company's main offerings include a no-code platform that automates biomarker discovery and interpretation, catering to professionals in the life sciences who may not have data science expertise. JADBio primarily serves the healthcare and medicine industry, with a particular emphasis on precision health. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Los Angeles, California.

Verily Life Sciences develops tools and devices to collect, organize and activate health data, and creates interventions to prevent and manage the disease. It partners with leading life sciences, medical devices, and government organizations, using deep hardware, software, scientific, and healthcare expertise to enable faster development, meaningful advances, and deployment at scale. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in South San Francisco, California.

Immunai operates as a biotechnology company. It maps the immune system with single-cell biology and artificial intelligence (AI) to power new therapeutic discoveries, accelerate drug development, and improve patient outcomes. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in New York, New York.

BenevolentAI (AMS: BAI) creates and applies AI and machine learning to update the way medicines are discovered and developed. Benevolent integrates its technology into every step of the drug discovery process, from hypothesis generation to late-stage clinical development. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in London, England.

Relay Therapeutics (NASDAQ: RLAY) combines computational skills with experimental approaches across the fields of structural biology, biophysics, chemistry and biology. The integration of these disparate disciplines, tools, and cultures enables the company to design therapies against validated but previously intractable targets. Its initial discovery programs in cancer have led to the development of highly selective inhibitors of disease-causing proteins in genomically defined patient populations.

Deep Genomics develops individualized genetic medicines by creating AI systems that are used to accelerate all steps of drug discovery and development, including target discovery, lead optimization, toxicity assessment, and trial design.
Freenome is an AI genomics biotechnology company in South San Francisco, California. By using a blood test, Freenome can help detect and treat cancer quickly and efficiently.
Valo is using cloud computing, as well as longitudinal and human data, to create an entirely new drug discovery and development process.

iCarbonX is developing an artificial intelligence platform to facilitate research related to the treatment of diseases, preventive care and precision nutrition. This approach is considered as an essential element to enable the future development of personalized medicine.

Aqemia serves as a pharma tech company that focuses on transforming the drug discovery process. Its main service is leveraging technology that combines quantum-inspired physics and machine learning to scale the drug discovery process, generating a rapidly growing pipeline of new drug candidates. It primarily sells to the pharmaceutical industry. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Paris, France.

Nimbus Therapeutics, formerly Nimbus Discovery, is a drug development company that focuses on metabolic diseases, cancer, and immune-inflammatory disorders. It combines computational technologies and machine learning-based predictive modeling approaches to progress small molecules through discovery and development. Its advanced programs include ACC, IRAK4, and Tyk2. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Atomic AI operates as a biotechnology company focused on the intersection of artificial intelligence and structural biology. The company's main offerings include the use of machine learning and structural biology to discover and design ribonucleic acid (RNA)-targeted small molecules, RNA-based medicines, and RNA tools. It primarily serves the biotechnology and healthcare industries. It was founded in 2021 and is based in South San Francisco, California.

23andMe is a personal genetics company dedicated to helping individuals understand genetic information through DNA analysis technologies and web-based interactive tools. The company's Personal Genome Service enables individuals to gain deeper insights into ancestry and inherited traits. The vision for 23andMe is to personalize healthcare by making and supporting meaningful discoveries through genetic research.

Century Health focuses on accelerating drug development and commercialization in the healthcare sector by leveraging artificial intelligence. The company offers a platform that integrates, normalizes, and provides insights from real-world disease-specific datasets to support various aspects of the medical industry. Century Health primarily serves sectors such as medical affairs, commercial, market access, health economics and outcomes research (HEOR), and real-world evidence (RWE). It was founded in 2023 and is based in Santa Monica, California

Ghost Autonomy engages in the development of autonomous driving software in the automotive industry. It offers a software solution that combines in-car artificial intelligence with vision-language models and primarily sells to the automotive industry. Ghost Autonomy was formerly known as Ghost. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) offers the DriveWell platform that scores driving performance, incentivizes safer driving, and provides crash notification and claims automation services for insurers, rideshares, and fleets. CMT specializes in mobile usage-based insurance with mobile telematics and analytics through its phone-only and phone+tag programs. The DriveWell platform is used worldwide. The company was founded in 2010 and is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
Luminar Technologies develops advanced sensor systems for the autonomous vehicle industry.

Magna International (NYSE: MGA) is an automotive supplier that designs, develops, and manufactures automotive systems, assemblies, modules, and components, and engineers and assembles complete vehicles, primarily for sale to original equipment manufacturers of cars and light trucks. The company was founded in 1957 and is based in Aurora, Canada.

Motional is an autonomous vehicle company making self-driving vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality. Motional is a joint venture between Hyundai Motor Group, one of the world's largest vehicle manufacturers and Aptiv, a global technology leader in advanced safety, electrification, and vehicle connectivity.

Helm.ai develops an artificial intelligence-based driving technology designed for autonomous driving. Its software is designed for advanced driver assistance systems, autonomous driving, and robotics, that can train neural networks without the need for fleet data, simulation, or annotation. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Menlo Park, California.

Pony.ai is a late-stage technology firm that aims to build autonomous driving solutions. Pony.ai's fully self-developed software algorithms and infrastructure enable vehicles to perceive their surroundings, predict what others will do, and maneuver themselves accordingly. The firm primarily serves automotive companies. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Fremont, California.

Nexar uses smartphones to create an AI-backed vehicle-to-vehicle network that works to predict and prevent accidents. Per the company, computer vision software aims to alert drivers to help them avoid accidents or receive updates on traffic problems like blocked lanes ahead. The company partners with third-party dashboard-camera makers and then uses deep learning which is run, per the company, on people's smartphones that are connected to their car cameras to recognize objects on the road. The company also aims to allow users to link their Nexar accounts to their insurance providers to speed up the claims process, i.e, sending a video of an accident, along with information like the time, date, and location of the collision. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) is an automaker and energy storage company that designs and sells highway-capable electric vehicles. It also sells patented power train components to other automakers, including the battery pack and charger for the electric Smart, built by German carmaker Daimler. Tesla sells its cars both online and via showrooms in major metropolitan areas.
Via develops mobility applications. It offers a platform for commuters to book and share a ride. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in New York, New York.

Waymo is a self-driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to move around. With the Waymo Driver, the company seeks to improve the worlds mobility while saving thousands of lives.

Cruise Automation makes automated driving technology. Cruise has built a highway autopilot system that installs on existing vehicles. It uses sensors and machine vision technology to keep users in their lane and a safe distance from the car in front of them. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in San Francisco, California. On March 20th, 2022, General Motors acquired a majority stake in Cruise Automation at a valuation between $19B to $30B.

Kodiak Robotics develops autonomous technology that carries freight forward. It offers a technology stack that is purpose-built for long-haul trucks, making the freight industry safer and more efficient. Kodiak's modular hardware approach, SensorPods, integrates sensors into a streamlined sensor-pod structure that optimizes for perception, scalability, and maintainability. The company delivers freight daily for its customers along six routes in Texas and Oklahoma, operating autonomously on the highway portions of the routes. Kodiak Robotics was founded in 2018 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Applied Intuition provides software infrastructure to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous vehicles at scale. Applied Intuition's simulation products, such as Simian, Spectral, and Orbis, aim to enable AV companies to test their systems safely, affordably, and at scale in virtual environments. The company's newest product offerings, including Strada, Logstream, and Basis, aim to help engineering teams effectively train AV algorithms with real-world drive data, meet regulatory requirements, and prepare for commercial deployment. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Aptiv, formerly Delphi Automotive, is a global technology company that develops safer, greener, and more connected solutions, which enable the future of mobility. The company was founded in 1980 and is based in Gillingham, U.K.
G7 Networks is a logistics big data company providing real-time tracking, analysis, and management of trucking fleets.

Phantom AI specializes in autonomous driving technology, focusing on advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) within the automotive industry. The company offers a comprehensive autonomous driving platform that includes computer vision, sensor fusion, and vehicle control solutions designed to enhance safety and the driving experience. Phantom AI's products are aimed at Tier 1 automotive manufacturers and OEMs, providing scalable and cost-effective solutions for various levels of vehicle automation. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Mountain View, California.

DiDi Global Inc. offers a wide range of app-based services across markets including Asia-Pacific, Latin America and Africa, including ride hailing, taxi hailing, chauffeur, hitch and other forms of shared mobility as well as auto solutions, food delivery, intra-city freight and financial services.

Merlin Labs operates as an aviation technology company. It is focused on developing autonomous flight capabilities. The company's main offering is the Merlin Pilot, a configurable software designed to adapt to any aircraft and enable future autonomous flight. Merlin Labs primarily serves the aviation industry. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Momenta is building the brain for autonomous vehicles. The company's deep learning-based software in perception, HD Map, and data-driven path planning enables the realization of full autonomy. Momenta pursue a two-leg strategy of autonomous driving for mass-production passenger vehicles (Mpilot) and full autonomy (MSD) for mobility service vehicles. Momenta focuses on partnering with existing automakers to use their vehicles as platforms for its equipment and software and to tap into their stores of data.

Wayve develops autonomous driving systems using artificial intelligence and machine learning. It focuses on building a data-driven learned driver that can scale, adapt and generalize its driving intelligence. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in London, U.K.

May Mobility is a technology company focused on delivering safe, self-driving transportation solutions to help reduce congestion, decrease pollution, and create greater economic benefits for urban communities around the world. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
NIO (NYSE: NIO) (9866.HK) (SGX: NIO) is a Chinese automobile manufacturer specializing in designing and developing safe electric autonomous vehicles.

Nuro is a robotics company transforming local commerce through driverless delivery. The company develops and operates a fleet of self-driving vehicles that deliver local goods of all kinds, from dinner to dry cleaning. Nuro's service helps merchants deliver goods to customers quickly, affordably, and safely.

Uber develops and supports technology applications that enable independent providers of ridesharing, and meal preparation and delivery services to transact with riders and eaters worldwide. Its driver partners provide ridesharing services through a range of vehicles, such as cars, auto rickshaws, motorbikes, minibuses, or taxis, as well as based on the number of riders under the UberBLACK, UberX, UberPOOL, Express POOL Uber Bus names.

Iron Ox grows fresh and sustainable produce from robotic greenhouses. Iron Ox grows produce in proprietary greenhouses designed, per the company, to reduce the environmental impact of agriculture using a data-driven approach with robotics and artificial intelligence.
Bowery Farming uses robotics, LED lighting, computer vision, sensors, and data analytics to grow leafy greens with no pesticides and very little water indoors.

HowGood is a company focused on providing sustainability intelligence for food companies. The company offers a user-friendly SaaS platform that provides instant data analysis for over 33,000 ingredients and materials, helping businesses to integrate environmental and social impact data into their product R&D process. The company primarily serves the food brands, retailers, ingredient suppliers, and food service sectors. It was founded in 2007 and is based in Stone Ridge, New York

Benson Hill (NYSE: BHIL) is a food technology company. It develops a technology platform that combines data, plant, and food sciences to create food, ingredient, and feed products. It uses machine learning technology to predict which seeds will produce a desired trait. The platform outputs can be deployed in crop plants by using a spectrum of approaches and tools, from breeding to genome editing to transgenics. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Saint Louis, Missouri.

Semios collects sensory data on every acre in near real-time, helping farmers manage the complex biosystems in orchards to optimize the sustainability and profitability of their crops. Its cloud-based analytics platform ingests highly granular data from over one million IoT sensors in the field, measuring in-canopy microclimate, soil and plant conditions every 10 minutes.

Blue River Technology creates and delivers advanced technology for better agriculture. The company's approach utilizes computer vision and robotics to build a future that 'makes every plant count' - where the needs of each plant are precisely measured and instantly responded to, significantly reducing chemical and nutrient use. The company brings substantial experience in precision agriculture, robotics, computer vision and machine learning.

Farmwise develops artificial intelligence-powered robots for sustainable farming at scale. The company is focused on the development of an autonomous vegetable weeder. It serves clients operating in the agriculture sector. The company was formerly known as Deeplook Technologies. It was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Regrow operates a digital platform that combines agronomy with soil and carbon modeling. Its platform delivers customized, site-specific, and scalable solutions to businesses across the supply chain. The company was formed after the merger between FluroSat and Dagan. It serves companies operating in the agriculture sector. The company was formerly known as Dagan. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Durham, New Hampshire.

Taranis, a precision agriculture intelligence platform, helps farmers increase their yields and effectively monitor their fields, make informed decisions and then act on them. The system uses computer vision, data science, and deep learning algorithms to detect early symptoms of weeds, uneven emergence, nutrient deficiencies, disease/insect infestations, water damage, equipment problems and more so that farmers can address issues quickly and understand the impact on yield and cost of production. Taranis was founded in 2014 and is based in Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel.

John Deere manufactures agricultural, construction, and forestry machinery, diesel engines, drivetrains used in heavy equipment and lawn care equipment. The company supplies replacement parts for its own products and for those of other manufacturers.

Farmers Business Network (FBN) allows farmers to anonymously share data about everything from seed performance to chemical pricing, harnessing the power of data science to help farmers make more informed decisions. FBN members receive comprehensive yield benchmarking, real world product performance analysis, and agronomic analytics based on real world data from the FBN community. The FBN Direct farm-commerce platform works with manufacturers to deliver substantially reduced input prices to members. FBN Direct's transparent pricing system has helped farmers realize savings of up to 50 percent on critical inputs.

Pachama focuses on climate change solutions within the environmental technology sector. The company offers services that allow businesses to invest in carbon credits, using artificial intelligence and satellite data to verify and monitor nature-based carbon sequestration projects. Pachama primarily serves businesses of all sizes, from large enterprises to small businesses, as well as individuals. It was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Verusen focuses on materials intelligence and the digitalization of the supply ecosystem, operating in the supply chain sectors. The company offers an AI-powered platform that harmonizes disparate material data across systems and processes, providing trusted data across the enterprise for supplier and operational risk. This platform is primarily used by the manufacturing and operations sectors. It was formerly known as Autit. It was founded in 2015 and is based in Atlanta, Georgia.

Basetwo Basetwo provides pharmaceutical manufacturers with a no-code artificial intelligence (AI) platform. It helps to build and deploy digital twins. It provides a platform, TwinOps that helps manufacturing engineers design, build, and operationalize digital twins of their production processes in order to reduce waste. It was founded in 2022 and is based in Mississauga, Canada.

General Electric (NYSE: GE) is an American multinational conglomerate corporation and digital industrial company. The company operates through the following segments: Power & Water, Oil and Gas, Renewable Energy, Aviation, Healthcare, Transportation, and Capital. It was founded in 1892 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Beyond Limits provides hybrid AI (Artificial Intelligence) solutions for smart energy, renewables, smart cities and transportation, carbon capture, and other intelligent infrastructure. It combines data-centric techniques with embedded human knowledge to affirm trust in software-driven decisions, manage operational risk, and drive profitability. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Glendale, California.

Augury's machine health AI predicts machine failures in and prescribes exactly when and how to correct them. Wireless sensors connect rotating equipment across industrial facilities and securely transmit mechanical data to the cloud. The data is then analyzed by proprietary cloud-based AI and prescriptive insights are delivered directly to maintenance/reliability personnel and manufacturing operations in real-time. Machine health insights are also contextualized with operational data to provide system-level insights across the manufacturing organization.
Instrumental offers a testing platform to manufacturers of electronics, to head off complicated problems before they start costing companies thousands of dollars per minute.

CloudMinds is an artificial intelligence and cloud computing company specializing in cloud-based smart robotics, secure cloud networks, large AI machine learning platforms, and secure smart terminal and robot controller technologies.

Locus Robotics designs and builds autonomous mobile robots that work collaboratively alongside workers in the logistics and fulfillment industries. Its multi-bot solution incorporates autonomous mobile robots that operate collaboratively with human workers to improve piecehandling, case-handling, and pallet-moving productivity. The company was founded in 2014 and based in Wilmington, Massachusetts.

Covariant engages in artificial intelligence and robotics within the logistics and fulfillment industry. It offers a range of robotic automation solutions for warehouse operations, including sortation, automated induction, robotic picking, automated assembly, and robotic depalletization. It primarily serves the logistics and fulfillment sector. It was formerly known as Embodied Intelligence. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Emeryville, California.

WeaveGrid works with utilities and electric vehicle (EV) owners to enable and accelerate the electrification of transportation. It provides a software solution that solves several EV-grid integration challenges for utilities, helps integrate renewable energy resources, and saves utility customers money on their bills. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

MakinaRocks is a global artificial intelligence (AI) software startup specializing in analytics and performance management with machine intelligence. MakinaRocks offers enterprise machine learning operations (MLOps) for the development and operation of AI models, as well as AI solutions such as anomaly detection and operational optimization to improve industrial productivity. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Seoul, South Korea.

Siemens (ETS:SIE) is an industrial manufacturing conglomerate whose principal divisions are industry, energy, healthcare, and infrastructure & cities. It offers smart township infrastructure, drive technology, financing, industrial automation, energy product, and others. The company was founded in 1874 and is based in Munich, Germany.

Osaro specializes in AI software for industrial automation. Osaro offers integrated perception and control software for industrial scale robotic deployments (ASRS systems, auto manufacturing, food prep, and e-commerce).

Arcol is a company that focuses on providing solutions in the architectural design and documentation sector. The company offers a collaborative 3D building design and documentation tool that allows for real-time collaboration, web-based modeling, and efficient conceptual design. This tool is designed to streamline the workflow of architects, enabling them to create, share, and modify designs with ease. It was founded in 2021 and is based in New York, New York.

Geek+ applies robotics and AI technologies to streamline operations for warehouses and supply chain management. The firm develops tailored solutions for a wide range of industries, including e-commerce, apparel, retail, logistics, 3PL, pharmaceutical, and manufacturing. It was founded in 2015 and is based in Beijing, Beijing.

AMP Robotics applies AI and automation to increase recycling rates and economically recover recyclables reclaimed as raw materials for the global supply chain. Its AMP Cortex high-speed robotics system automates the identification and sorting of recyclables from mixed material streams. The AMP Neuron" AI platform continuously trains itself by recognizing different colors
Stem combines big data, predictive analytics and energy storage to reduce electric costs for businesses and in aggregate, deliver services to the grid.

Johnson Controls (NYSE: JCI) provides products such as batteries, security, electronics, HVAC equipment, digital solutions, oil and gas solutions, fire safety, and more. It was formerly known as Johnson Service Company. The company was founded in 1885 and is based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. In September 2016, Johnson Controls was acquired by Tyco. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Built Robotics mission is to build robots that build the world. By upgrading off-the-shelf heavy equipment with AI guidance systems, Builts technology enables machines to operate fully autonomously. Builts robots are deployed today across the $1 trillion earthmoving industry and are being used to build critical infrastructures, such as wind farms, gas pipelines, and new housing developments. Built Robotics was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Scortex is a software and hardware product for industrial companies that combines computer vision and deep learning to develop a machine vision inspection solution for manufacturing. Scortex was founded in 2016 and is based in Paris, France. On May 17th, 2022, Scortex was acquired by Trigo Groupe. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Cognite provides a platform that liberates industrial data from separate, siloed systems and reveals the data in a structured and contextualized manner, presenting a full, virtual view of industrial reality - both past and present - made accessible and actionable for humans and machines. The company creates software for oil and gas, power and utilities, renewable energy, manufacturing and other asset-heavy industries. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Lysaker, Norway.

Higharc operates as a homebuilding automation platform. It allows homebuilders to create and manage digital plans, track progress, and collaborate with team members. The platform also allows homebuyers to shop for homes online and customize their plans. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in Durham, North Carolina.
Path Robotics is a Columbus based company that produces autonomous welding robots based on proprietary AI and computer vision algorithms.

Augmenta provides construction management services. The company uses artificial intelligence, including machine learning and mathematical optimization which enables contractors and engineers to create error-free, constructible, code-compliant designs of buildings. Augmenta was founded in 2018 and is based in Toronto, Canada.

Agile Robots researches and develops an intelligent robot system. The core products include a 7-degree-of-freedom lightweight arm, a general-purpose robot controller, and a robot vision system. The company has developed a robotic operating system based on core technologies such as force-controlled robotics, machine vision, motion planning, adaptive crawling, human-machine collaboration, simulation learning, and reinforcement learning. Agile Robots was founded in 2018 and is based in Munich, Germany.

Deepomatic is an artificial intelligence software editor. It is an image recognition platform designed to build image vision datasets. Its platform automatically monetizes images published by web and mobile media. The company caters to telecommunications, utilities and cross-industry. Deepomatic was founded in 2014 and is based in Paris, France.

Zapata AI develops quantum technologies for computing systems. It offers a quantum autoencoder to deliver a workflow-based toolset for quantum computing. It serves the aerospace, consumer goods, and energy industries. Zapata AI was formerly known as Zapata Computing. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

Boston Dynamics builds robots for logistic services. It uses computer vision technology, which enables the device to identify boxes easily and without any pre-programming. The bot can also work autonomously through complex situations like disordered stacking configurations and recovering fallen boxes. Boston Dynamics was founded in 1992 and is based in Waltham, Massachusetts. In December 2020, Hyundai Motor Company acquired a majority stake in Boston Dynamics at a valuation of $1.1B.

Intrinsic is a robotics software and AI company that aims to make industrial robotics accessible and usable for businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. It focuses on advances in AI, perception and simulation of robotics with software and data and by providing access to intelligent capabilities. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Phaidra is a company that focuses on artificial intelligence (AI) for mission critical facilities in the industrial sector. The company offers a virtual plant operator service, which is a closed-loop AI control system that aims to improve plant stability, energy efficiency, and sustainability. Phaidra primarily sells to the industrial sector, including areas such as pharmaceutical production, data centers, and district energy. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Seattle, Washington.

Muir AI develops an analytic platform designed to measure and reduce emissions. Its platform helps in measuring emissions based on fused data from satellites, industry reports, and proprietary databases, enabling users to eliminate high-polluting suppliers, quantify the emissions impact of new product designs, and adhere to sustainability commitments such as sustainable sourcing. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Seattle, Washington.

Outrider provides artificial intelligence (AI) based logistics services. The company develops yard operations for logistics hubs and helps enterprises with safety and efficiency. Outrider was founded in 2017 and is based in Golden, Colorado.

Retrocausal focuses on manufacturing assembly optimization through artificial intelligence in the manufacturing industry. The company offers a software platform that provides digital work instructions with step verification to reduce mistakes, enables continuous time studies and analysis to optimize processes, and captures every step of assembly for quality analysis and recall support. Retrocausal primarily sells to sectors such as automotive, medical devices, appliances and hardware, electronics, and defense. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Redmond, Washington.

Matroid aims to simplify computer vision using machine learning, and enables users to take advantage of the information inherently embedded in video. Users can build their own detector within the company's intuitive, non-technical, web platform to detect people and most other objects.

Verkada is a physical security platform used to protect people and assets in a privacy-respecting manner. The company's six product lines - video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, visitor management, and mailroom management - provide visibility of building security through an integrated, secure cloud-based platform. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Crisp provides a platform that uses data available to create a precise forecast for suppliers, food brands, retailers and distributors in order to optimize profitability and drive production efficiency. The company offers a platform that connects and analyzes retail data across the supply chain. Crisp serves suppliers, distributors, retailers and agencies in the global food industry. The company was formerly known as Motiion and changed it's name to Crisp. Crisp was founded in 2018 and is based in Brooklyn, New York.

Agility Robotics is a robotic company that designs and builds bi-pedal robot Digit, a multi-purpose, human-centric robot that is made for various purposes. Its robots are used in industries such as academic, corporate, and military research and development sectors. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Tangent, Oregon.

Exodigo is a technology company that provides non-intrusive underground mapping solutions, using advanced sensors, three-dimensional (3D) imaging, and artificial intelligence (AI) to create maps of the subsurface. Its services to infrastructure project owners and managers in the aforementioned sectors. It was founded in 2021 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

Snaptrude offers automated 3-dimensional design software for architects. The software enables interactive online and offline virtual reality tours. It allows users to upload hand-drawn diagrams and sketches of architectural plans and converts them to 2D diagrams and 3D models. It offers its solutions to architects, interior designers, and real estate developers. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Briq is a financial automation platform operating in the construction industry. The company's main services include connecting operational, financial, and project information in one place to facilitate easier, faster, and more efficient analysis and forecasting. It primarily sells to the construction industry. It was founded in 2017 and is based in Santa Barbara, California.

Schneider Electric (OTCMKTS: SBGSY) is a European multinational corporation that specializes in energy management, and automation solutions, spanning hardware, software, and services. It is involved in the digital transformation of energy management and automation in homes, buildings, data centers, infrastructure, and industries. The company was founded in 1836 and is based in Rueil-Malmaison, France.

Skydio manufactures autonomous drones. The company uses AI to create intelligent flying machines that serve a variety of industries including defense, utilities, transportation, public safety, and more. Skydio was founded in 2014 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Bright Machines provides software that aims to automate manufacturing operations in factories. The company integrates computer vision, machine learning, 3D simulation, and robotics that help in the flexibility and scalability of manufacturing. It primarily caters to the manufacturing industry. The company was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Uptake develops a predictive analytics software that collects and interprets sensor data for clients in mining, rail, energy, aviation, retail, and construction industries. It combines data science, and workflow connectivity to build solutions based on data sets, identify problems, and manage the productivity. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Mississauga, Canada.

Helsing is a defense AI company that focuses on software solutions for democratic societies. The company specializes in real-time information processing and turning unstructured sensor data into actionable insights for governments, aiming to enhance the effectiveness of defense forces. Helsing's technology is designed to provide clarity in various operating environments, ensuring that democratic nations can maintain sovereignty and uphold ethical standards. It was founded in 2021 and is based in München, Germany.

Vannevar Labs develops machine learning products. It uses artificial intelligence integrated systems to overcome critical national security problems. It offers features such as data collection, natural language processing, managed attribution platform, and more services. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Dataminr is a data analytics company that develops technology to unlock hidden value in real-time public social media data. Servicing both buy-side and sell-side financial firms, as well as the public sector, news, and corporate risk clients, Dataminr has developed a broad suite of modular desktop and API products that transform publicly available social media streams into signals. The company's applications detect events and consumer signals by leveraging social media as a sensor network, delivering decision-making alerts to clients around the world. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in New York, New York.

Mark43 is an intuitive law enforcement information management software start-up. Mark43 meaningfully reduces administrative work, enabling the first true mobile data entry system, cutting edge big data analysis, and the ability to share data across different law enforcement departments nationally.

Yurts is a developer of an application development platform designed to create large model architectures. The company's platform uses artificial intelligence to develop software featuring GPT, OPT, and other complex model architectures, enabling businesses to design applications. It builds AI for research, enterprise, education, and defense. It was founded in 2022 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Fortem Technologies specializes in airspace awareness, security, and defense, focusing on the detection and defeat of dangerous drones within various sectors. The company offers an advanced end-to-end system that includes distributed radar, AI at the Edge, deep sensor integration, and autonomous drone capture capabilities. These solutions are designed to monitor and protect venues, infrastructures, cities, and regions, while also facilitating the safety of airspace for urban air mobility. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Pleasant Grove, Utah.

Hadrian manufactures critical precision components in autonomous factories. It provides factories with precision components and enables frontier technology enterprises to make rocket ships with the assistance of advanced manufacturing. Hadrian was formerly known as Manufacturing Technology Ventures. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in Torrance, California.

Astranis builds telecommunications satellites. It provides bandwidth-as-a-service to governments and commercial enterprises. Its facilities can control the cost of internet services in remote areas with small, powerful satellites for geostationary orbit. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in San Francisco, California.

SkyWatch develops an Application Programming Interface (API) to provide a point to discover and access remote sensing datasets in geospatial analytics. The company offers to monitor the progress of crops, predict the markets, track ships, and more, It was founded in 2014 and is based in Kitchener, Canada.

Hayden AI offers an autonomous traffic management platform to help cities become safer and more sustainable. Cities use Hayden AIs sensors, software, and data to improve urban mobility and quality of life for their communities. The company was founded in 2019 and is based in Oakland, California.

StreetLight Data makes it easy and intuitive to use big data for transportation and urban planning, retail, and real estate. The company transforms trillions of anonymous location records from mobile devices into analytics that describe group travel patterns. Its easy-to-use online platform, StreetLight InSight, takes the hassle out of using big data. It lets you design, visualize, and download custom metrics in just a few mouse clicks. On February 7th, 2022, StreetLight Data was acquired by Jacobs. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Modern Intelligence is a company that focuses on artificial intelligence in the defense sector. The company offers high-fidelity target analysis and decision-making capabilities, which can be integrated with any hardware or software platform. The primary customer base of Modern Intelligence is the defense industry. Modern Intelligence was formerly known as Dulin Defense. It was founded in 2020 and is based in San Jose, California.

Astra operates as a company focused on space technology and services. It provides dedicated small launches and on-orbit mobility for small satellite builders and operators. Astra primarily serves the aerospace industry. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Alameda, California.

Fleet Space Technologies is a space tech company. It operates a fleet of commercial micro-satellites. It uses its commercial satellite constellation to explore critical minerals around the world. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in Beverley, Australia.

Kayhan Space operates as a cloud-based space flight dynamics and mission analysis platform. It provides cloud-based collision avoidance service, satellite conjunction assessment, and space object tracking and navigation. It was founded in 2019 and is based in Boulder, Colorado.

Apex operates as a spacecraft development company. It manufactures evolved secondary payload adapter (ESPA)-class satellites. It offers a spacecraft bus platform named Aries that is built for low-earth orbit (LEO) missions for earth observation (EO), and communication. Its platform allows clients to access payload integration, flight booking, and flight coordination. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in Sherman Oaks, California.

Saronic Technologies manufactures surface equipment to serve the marine industry. It provides marine hardware, software, and related artificial intelligence solutions in an integrated platform that enables maritime security and autonomy. The company was founded in 2022 and is based in Austin, Texas.

TurbineOne is a company that focuses on multi-domain intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance in the technology sector. The company's main services include automating data feeds, enabling users to build their own detectors, and providing automatic alerts to drive decision advantage. Their products are designed to improve speed and accuracy in data analysis, and they offer a do-it-yourself machine learning solution. TurbineOne primarily sells to the public sector, particularly those involved in national security. It was founded in 2021 and is based in San Francisco, California

Saildrone designs and manufactures wind and solar-powered autonomous surface vehicles. It provides data solutions and insights for subjects ranging from maritime security to mapping, to earth system processes such as weather forecasting, carbon cycling, global fishing, and climate change. It was founded in 2014 and is based in Alameda, California.
Epirus is a startup that builds modern defense systems to address 21st century threats, such as drones and other asymmetric technologies.

Anduril builds products to aid in the protection of borders, infrastructure, and national security assets. It develops border control technology that includes towers with cameras and infrared sensors that use artificial intelligence to track movement and its core technology includes autonomous systems, sensor fusion, and the application of these technologies at the front lines of operations. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in Irvine, California.

OpenGov offers enterprise cloud solutions for governments. The OpenGov Cloud platform offers cloud solutions for budgeting, performance, communications, and reporting. The platform helps stakeholders connect to the budget process, provides feedback, and forecasts personnel costs. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in San Jose, California.

Epsilon3 specializes in software for managing aerospace operations and procedures. The company develops a platform to enable satellite deployment and operations, human spaceflight, launch operations, vehicle manufacturing, integration and testing, robotics deployment, testing, and more. The company was founded in 2021 and is based in Santa Monica, California.

Loft Orbital deploys space infrastructure as a service. The company offers services that include the deployment of customer missions to space, handling the complexity of space missions, and providing software and hardware products to operate any payload on a standard satellite bus. It primarily serves the aerospace industry. The company was founded in 2017 and is based in San Francisco, California.

ABL Space Systems focuses on launch vehicle and launch systems technology development in the aerospace industry. The company offers a satellite launch vehicle and a containerized launch system that can activate orbital launch from any flat pad globally. The company primarily serves the satellite industry. It was founded in 2017 and is based in El Segundo, California.

Xona Space Systems focuses on precision navigation in space systems. The company offers a real-time positioning, navigation, and timing (PNT) service that provides secure and accurate navigation and timing services, designed to support autonomous operations. It was founded in 2019 and is based in San Mateo, California.

Shield AI is a defense technology company building artificial intelligence (AI) pilots for aircraft. Its Hivemind software is an AI pilot for military and commercial aircraft that enables intelligent teams of aircraft to perform missions ranging from room clearance to penetrating air defense systems and dogfighting F-16s. It assists in planning, mapping, and state estimation to enable aircraft to execute dynamic flight maneuvers. The company was founded in 2015 and is based in San Diego, California.

LeoLabs specializes in space operations and tracking services within the aerospace industry. The company offers a suite of services including satellite tracking, collision avoidance, launch support, and mission risk assessment for various space-related activities. LeoLabs primarily serves satellite operators, commercial enterprises, defense agencies, and insurers in the space sector. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Menlo Park, California.

BlueHalo aims to provide industry-leading capabilities in space superiority, directed energy, missile defense and C4ISR, and cyber and intelligence mission solutions. BlueHalo is focused on inspired engineering to develop, transition, and field next-generation capabilities to solve the challenges of its customers' critical missions and reestablish the national security posture in the near-peer contested arena.

Adarga is a company that focuses on the development of artificial intelligence software, primarily operating in the Defence, National Security, and Commercial sectors. The company's main service involves processing large volumes of information, such as global news feeds, reports, and presentations, using advanced AI to extract essential facts and present them to users in comprehensible formats. This service is primarily used by organizations in the Defence/Public Sector and the Commercial Sector. It was founded in 2016 and is based in London, England

Orbital Insight develops an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered geospatial analytics platform. It uses artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze satellite imagery, mobile location data, and other sources of geospatial data. It helps governments and businesses track things like deforestation, illegal mining, supply chains, logistics, and more. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Blue Origin specializes in aerospace and spaceflight services. It focuses on controlling the cost of access to space. The company designs and manufactures reusable rocket engines, launch vehicles, in-space systems, and lunar landers. Its primary market includes government and commercial entities in the space exploration and satellite deployment sectors. It was founded in 2000 and is based in Kent, Washington.

Percipient.ai provides an advanced analytics service that offers a machine learning platform that uses open-source technologies to support multi-intelligence sources and missions. Percipient.ai was founded in 2017 and is based in Santa Clara, California.

Unanimous AI specializes in artificial intelligence (AI) in the domain of collective intelligence amplification. The company offers a platform that uses Swarm AI technology to enhance the intelligence of networked business teams, enabling them to generate more accurate forecasts, decisions, and insights. It facilitates Swarm Analytics, Swarm Platform, Swarm Insight Services, and more. It primarily serves the business sector, with a particular emphasis on market research and business forecasting. It was founded in 2014 and is based in Pismo Beach, California.

Varda builds a space station dedicated to industrial use. It focuses on creating products in space for terrestrial applications. It offers an infrastructure to harvest source materials for new products in-space via asteroid mining. The company was founded in 2020 and is based in El Segundo, California.

Blackshark.ai provides a geospatial platform. It extracts insights about the planet's infrastructure from current satellite and aerial imagery via machine learning. It allows for powerful visualization and simulation applications catering to government, geospatial intelligence, humanitarian relief, planetary management, autonomous driving and flying, insurance, smart cities, and more sectors. It was founded in 2020 and is based in Graz, Austria.

Hedron operates as a satellite communications company. The company's main offering involves building a network of data relay satellites that facilitate real-time connection between space and Earth. It primarily caters to sectors that require real-time data for various purposes such as monitoring maritime areas, predicting natural disasters, and evolving agriculture. It was formerly known as Analytical Space. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Air Space Intelligence operates as a software aerospace company. It uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help air operators make decisions. The company's product, Flyways AI provides a predictive geospatial picture of the operating domain, helping operators to identify, contextualize, and visualize potential threats. It was founded in 2018 and is based in San Francisco, California.
Rebellion aims to empower the military and US civil servants and allies through AI and machine learning to solve defense challenges for the government.

SpaceX focuses on the designing, manufacturing, and launching of rockets and spacecraft, operating within the aerospace industry. The company's main services include the production and operation of rockets and spacecraft. It was founded in 2002 and is based in Hawthorne, California.
Northwood Space manufactures ultra-wideband gateways for satellite backhaul. The company was founded in 2023 and is based in El Segundo, California.

Radian Aerospace manufactures aviation and aerospace components. It develops reusable horizontal takeoff and landing, single-stage to-orbit spaceplanes. It was founded in 2016 and is based in Bellevue, Washington.

FiscalNote (NYSE: NOTE) is an information services company focused on global policy and market intelligence. By combining AI technology, expert analysis, and legislative, regulatory, and geopolitical data, FiscalNote provides a platform for real-time, government analysis. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in Washington, D.C.

Dedrone develops an anti-drone early-warning and identification system. It provides early warning of illegal unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and protects industrial plants, government buildings, and other critical infrastructure installations against smugglers, spies, and terrorist attacks. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Sterling, Virginia.

Voyager Labs specializes in AI-driven technologies for human behavior analysis. It enables investigators to analyze massive amounts of open, deep, and dark web data as well as internal data and understand the content, human interactions, and connections. It serves government and law enforcement agencies, as well as private sector customers. It was founded in 2012 and is based in New York, New York.

Veritone (NASDAQ: VERI) operates as a software company. The company provides software, services, and industrial applications that transform audio, video, and other data sources into actionable intelligence through its artificial intelligence (AI) operating system, aiWARE.Energy. It caters to the government, media, broadcast, and sports sectors. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Denver, Colorado.

SparkCognition builds AI solutions for applications in energy, oil and gas, manufacturing, finance, aerospace, defense, and security. SparkCognition's products include Darwin for automated model building, DeepArmor for AI-built cybersecurity, SparkPredict, an analytics solution, and DeepLNP, a natural language processing solution.

C3.ai (NYSE: AI) is an AI software provider that delivers the C3 AI Suite for developing, deploying, and operating large-scale AI, predictive analytics, and IoT applications at scale for any enterprise value chain in any industry. The core of the C3.ai offering is a model-driven AI architecture that enhances data science and application development. C3.ais pre-built applications, for a variety of industries, include predictive maintenance, fraud detection, supply network optimization, energy management, and anti-money laundering.

The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks in an encoder-decoder configuration. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.0 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.

PaLM 2 is our next generation large language model that builds on Googles legacy of breakthrough research in machine learning and responsible AI.

It excels at advanced reasoning tasks, including code and math, classification and question answering, translation and multilingual proficiency, and natural language generation better than our previous state-of-the-art LLMs, including PaLM. It can accomplish these tasks because of the way it was built  bringing together compute-optimal scaling, an improved dataset mixture, and model architecture improvements.

RoBERTa iterates on BERT's pretraining procedure, including training the model longer, with bigger batches over more data; removing the next sentence prediction objective; training on longer sequences; and dynamically changing the masking pattern applied to the training data. In a paper published today in Nature, we introduce AlphaGeometry, an AI system that solves complex geometry problems at a level approaching a human Olympiad gold-medalist - a breakthrough in AI performance. In a benchmarking test of 30 Olympiad geometry problems, AlphaGeometry solved 25 within the standard Olympiad time limit. For comparison, the previous state-of-the-art system solved 10 of these geometry problems, and the average human gold medalist solved 25.9 problems.

The XLNet model was proposed in XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding by Zhilin Yang, Zihang Dai, Yiming Yang, Jaime Carbonell, Ruslan Salakhutdinov, Quoc V. Le. XLnet is an extension of the Transformer-XL model pre-trained using an autoregressive method to learn bidirectional contexts by maximizing the expected likelihood over all permutations of the input sequence factorization order.

We introduce Vicuna-13B, an open-source chatbot trained by fine-tuning LLaMA on user-shared conversations collected from ShareGPT. Preliminary evaluation using GPT-4 as a judge shows Vicuna-13B achieves more than 90%\* quality of OpenAI ChatGPT and Google Bard while outperforming other models like LLaMA and Stanford Alpaca in more than 90%\* of cases. The cost of training Vicuna-13B is around $300. The code and weights, along with an online demo, are publicly available for non-commercial use.

Text-driven image and video diffusion models have recently achieved unprecedented generation realism. While diffusion models have been successfully applied for image editing, very few works have done so for video editing. We present the first diffusion-based method that is able to perform text-based motion and appearance editing of general videos. Our approach uses a video diffusion model to combine, at inference time, the low-resolution spatio-temporal information from the original video with new, high resolution information that it synthesized to align with the guiding text-prompt. As obtaining high-fidelity to the original video requires retaining some of its high-resolution information, we add a preliminary stage of finetuning the model on the original video, significantly boosting fidelity. We propose to improve motion editability by a new, mixed objective that jointly finetunes with full temporal attention and with temporal attention masking. We further introduce a new framework for image animation. We first transform the image into a coarse video by simple image processing operations such as replication and perspective geometric projections, and then use our general video editor to animate it. As a further application, we can use our method for subject-driven video generation. Extensive qualitative and numerical experiments showcase the remarkable editing ability of our method and establish its superior performance compared to baseline methods.

DistilBERT is a small, fast, cheap and light Transformer model trained by distilling BERT base. It has 40% less parameters than google-bert/bert-base-uncased, runs 60% faster while preserving over 95% of BERT’s performances as measured on the GLUE language understanding benchmark.

Explorium is a data science company that helps companies get better data to feed into their predictive models. Explorium's engine can ingest a company's data, connect with tens of thousands of external data sources, and then generate predictive features/variables from these external sources automatically, running its own machine learning models to ensure that the most relevant, predictive data is added, building more accurate machine learning models.
